We booked on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast was nice with lots to choose from e.g. Cereals, pastries, breads, fresh fruits, cold meats, cheeses, yogurts, eggs etc. Hotel also has a restaurant in the grounds which I have reviewed separately as it's also open to the public. Don't go- way over rated and priced. Did not try the room service and if you want to go out to eat at night it is a bit of a walk (15/20 mins). Hotel also has a car park but charge 6.50 Euro/day to use which I think should be free for residents. Enjoyed our stay and would stay again if ever back in Elche.

I have gait challenges (stroke); accom. has to be convenient to shopping and/or sights.
Being very central, it is also very tranquil; a beautiful property. Well-appointed rooms and facilities. Close to sights, historic old town, tapas, beers, shops, restaurants. Parking was great. Would recommend.

Just a short walk from the centre of town, this is a charming and attractive hotel. I was impressed with the number of cosy and romantic seating areas located in the hotel, including a large balcony with comfortable chairs, ideal for a sundowner! Our room was large, nicely decorated with a very comfortable bed. There was also a small settee and two chairs and a small desk. The bathroom was a good size with a bath/shower and attractively tiled. Although it was too cold to use the pool, that too looked very attractive and inviting. The gardens and the outside seating areas were also well maintained and attractive.

We also enjoyed an excellent dinner in the hotel restaurant, which is located in the gardens adjacent to the hotel. The food was really delicious, beautifully presented and the service discrete and professional, The hotel receptionist was also very friendly and helpful

titulo: Clean and lovely affordable hotel located in the center of town
conteudo:
The hotel was well situated and offered clean and comfortable accommodations.
The staff was friendly and very accommodating. We requested a room change to the quieter side of the building only because the one we had faced the main street. Without hesitation we were given another room. The rooms are spacious, with large closet space, a mini fridge and a large bed. The bathroom was huge. We were lucky that during the time of our visit the hotel was offering a breakfast special for a buffet breakfast at 7 EUR per person. The food was fresh, with a good variety. I highly recommend this place and will stay there again when I return.

I picked this hotel as it was not too far from the airport and seemed quiet.
The hotel is beautifully situated in the palm groves but a short 10 minute walk to the city. The hotel has a lovely outdoor pool in the garden & sauna on the roof , I also saw a small gym but it was too hot for strenuous exercise.
The room was a good size, comfortable bed & very clean. The shower was an over bath small head so wasn't expecting much but wow it was really powerful. There was also a radio in the bathroom which was a great touch.
Air conditioning was very good & so quiet, didn't even realise it was on until you stepped out the room & felt the heat.
WiFi is free & quite fast, there was a TV in the room but never got round to switching it on.
Breakfast was very good - great selection of food presented in a very clean setting, it was incredible that with the heat there were no flies. Coffee came out of a machine it was good but mysterious as came out hot but within few minutes was cold, never managed to keep coffee warm enough to drink & enjoy.
Meal's were a challenge, lunch in the bar was limited but enjoyed the Caesar Salad & Spanish omelette however at the end of the week I was given a different menu that didn't have an English translation so had to rely on picking out odd words to work out what was on offer & the assistance of the waiter, he seemed a bit surprised when I asked for the English translated menu as if it didn't exist that was a weird moment, but I had a delicious asparagus dish that certainly wasn't on the other menu - all very twilight zone.
I have to mention the dogs as really there is no escaping their noise, I was told by reception that there are 4 dogs belonging to their neighbour. What astounds me that the noise nuisance caused by the dogs has been allowed to go on & why has no one taken direct action! The dogs do not just bark they whine particularly when police car goes by with sirens blaring. Still having read trip advisor I was prepared & as the windows were closed because of aircon they didn't really bother me but they do go on throughout the night.
Great hotel, lovely staff highly recommend.

We found the experience different from our normal holiday venue primarily because of the distance from any part of the coast and Elche being more of a large town environment. If you are in need of a pharmacy , dentist or doctors , these were in more abundance than any good Restuarant or general shopping area. Although the centre of Elche had a few museums, a cathedral and palm tree plantation this was not enough to capture our interest for 9 days !! . This was the first time we have not hired a car whilst on holiday in Spain but felt the bus service from Elche to other areas i.e Alicante, Murcia were very inexpensive and very good service. Not only were the Restuarant staff unfriendly but could not offer a good level of food and very few spoke English. After visiting the sister hotel Huerto Del Cura ( approx 10 mins away from Jardin ) we found this to be a much more pleasant alternative in a better setting and closer to the centre. Also found their restaurant to be the finest eateries in Elche and would recommend this . BEWARE : The tourist information board in Elche were very efficient and handed us a 10% discount brochure against 4 hotels one of which being the Jardin Milenio on presentation to hotel against our final bill. It was firstly accepted that they agreed to the discount , only to be told 48 hours later that they would not honour the discount as we had booked with booking.com. This we disputed as it was not showing on the brochure and after protracted conversations with the hotel they gave us 5% token discount on 3 of the 9 nights. This left a very bad taste !

Older, wiser? Getting to know and like these hidden gems / boutique hotels.

You won't go wrong with this one - a lovely lovely hotel set in fabulous lawns and gardens on the outskirts ( 5 min walk ) from central Elche.

Nice clean rooms with free Air Con and great free fast WiFi.

Breakfast clean fresh, hot where necessary, cold where not.

Put this hotel on your list if you're undecided and flying / sailing into Alicante or Murcia region.

Great rooms, pool quiet and equipped, off the beaten track but a small walk to restaurants and bars if wanted, also not far to the beach on the bus, great service, very accommodating although need to ask, would recommend for a very Spanish break.

Lovely rooms, friendly staff and beautiful views of endless palm trees where ever you look. The restaurant was really special but as we had booked a half board deal which was amazing value the food was very disappointing , however if you have the a la carte menu it had a better variety of choices.
The pool area was fantastic and again stunning views.

Invited here for a weeding we spent three days in this structure. The Hotel is placed not far from the centre of Elche (5/10 minutes walking) in a beautiful park. The hotel is renovated with a beautiful pool inside the green park. Rooms are clean, huge with AC and all what is needed for a comfort stay. Staff is nice and the breakfast is really good with a wide choice. Price in line with the quality of the service offered. Well done!

My friend booked this for us as a 4 day getaway in the sun. I had no other expectations than sunbathing, cocktails and tapas to be honest! It cost about 25 euros by taxi to get there...we discovered there is a bus you can get that takes to the airport from the town but we waited an hour and every bus that came said it was the next one..maybe we were unlucky but I'd say get the cab. It's inland and very pretty, right by the palm Grove. I recommend using your first day to wander about and get your bearings. We headed right out of the hotel and 10-15mins walk gets you to the town. There's a few cheap as chips supermarkets (we carried big bottles of water back to our room to have by the pool) and a selection of restaurants and cafes. Reception were so amazing at helping us with bus routes, restaurant recommendations, Natalie in particular was great. Also a lady who was doing an internship - again so helpful and smiley and friendly. There's a masseuse Maria who can come in, she does AMAZING massages for a great price. The rooms were cleaned to a great standard every day, the food at the restaurant is delicious and the cocktails were so good! The pool was a decent size and the perfect place to cool down after a few hours in the sun. Everything is just quiet, well looked after and I guess because it is less touristy you do get to properly switch off. We did. Be prepared to brush up on a few words of Spanish as we found a fair few places struggled with English and some didn't have English menus. They try to help when they can...the hotel was great for this ... our waiters were always pleasant and respectful. There's nothing I could fault about this hotel and our holiday at all. Go! You won't be disappointed!

I booked the hotel after seeing the photos. It is in fact a beautiful location not far from the 'Huerto del Cura'. The staff were quite helpful although we did have a problem with my booking.....or rather they said there was a problem, but after messing around on their computer for about 20 minutes they realized that my booking was ok!!
The room was spacious with two enormous beds. The pool area looked very relaxing but the weather was not so good so we didn't use it. Breakfast a good variety of sweet and savoury food.

titulo: Poor cleaning and poor maintenance of the room
conteudo: I booked this hotel for its position - close to The Palm Grove (El Palmeral), and for its great reviews, but I was a bit disappointed. Everyone talks about its beautiful garden, big rooms and very rich breakfast. These all are true, but another true is that the rooms (or at least the one I received) are not well preserved and the cleaning is really poor. You can see the attached pictures.

A blocked drain in the bathroom which looked to be a regular occurence was sorted within an hour. Dogs barking at 2am and 5am for over an hour at a time, when I had asked for a quiet room. These problems stopped me awarding an excellent review.

hotel very pretty surroundings and tidy. very near airport about 30 minutes away and taxi was around 25 euro. i was only there one night and had to be up early so they made me a pack up breakfast and wake up call, lady called esther (i think) on reception was lovely and very helpful, she kindly opened up/turned on the sauna for me which had a nice view of palm trees and i watched the sunset

titulo: The hotel is in the middle of palm trees
conteudo: Nice hotel in a beautiful location amongst palm garden. Close to the historical city center where a lot of attractions and restaurants. Good breakfast and dinner. Clean room cleaning. Beautiful garden

This is a lovely and comfortable hotel. It has a retro feel but not at the cost of any comfort (wi-fi, well equipped bathroom, ....) Breakfast though offering a limited number of choices was tasty and met our expectations. The staff was pleasant and helpful.
The rooms were rather large and well furnished. The hotel was easy to reach and offers a nice parking lot in the back.

This is an unusual but delightful hotel set in amongst palm trees with a lovely outdoor pool. it is quiet and comfortable and clean the staff are helpful.
The restaurant is excellent and I had a wonderful tapas full of delicious flavours. A most enjoyable stay.

the hotel is very clean the room was spacious however there wasn't any tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We could have ordered it through room service but there is only 1 member of staff working on the bar, dining room and room service so the wait would have been hours.
The breakfast is 10€ extra we tried it once it wasn't worth the 10€ so we didn't bother again.
Car parking is 6.50€ daily.
The downside of this hotel is the constant barking of neighbours dogs day and night.
The hotel felt like an English Travel Lodge rather a than a 4* Hotel.
The town of Elche is beautiful with lovely restaurants and it was very Spanish which we liked.

A very nice hotel, lovely big room overlooking the patio , very clean towels and bed linen changed daily, the staff were very friendly and helpful too, we stayed for a week as we had a wedding to go to in Elche, lovely pool area to relax and have a drink and a bite to eat too, not far to walk to the centre. not far from Alicante either. we would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for an early flight home. The hotel is very clean and the staff most helpful. The room was very large with a sofa. The bathroom is also large. The whole hotel is nicely decorated. If you just want a snack the bar is very cheap - pizza 7 euros and salad 8 euros. The downside is parking is 6.5 euros.

We had a Spacious room overlooking the Patio. The room had a very well thought out large bathroom. We had booked half board and had our dinner in the bar, had we wanted to eat in the very attractive restaurant near to the swimming pool, we would have had to pay a supplement. The dinner was good and the breakfast was excellent.
All of the staff were very, very helpful and we would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel. The only downside was the noise from the barking dogs in a nearby private house. Fortunately the double glazing was good, so when the windows were shut the noise was reduced. The wifi was fine for downloading emails, but slow for anything else.
origem: San Juan de los Terreros, Spain

conteudo: Really enjoyed our stay here. Hotel was clean and relaxing. The pool is great with a nice spacious area for chilling out and having a refreshing drink. Elche town is walking distance away and a beautiful place to visit with plenty of shopping to be had.

Clean and cozy hotel. Around lot of palms,nice view.good service ,rooms are big enought. Restaurant la taula very good and high quality food.swimming pool...................................................................

Stopped here for the night whilst heading to the south of Spain. easy to find of the AP7 and located in the palmeras gardens area. Free parking and a nice welcome form reception staff and pleased with the large spacious room and free wifi. The restaurant was closed for the season and the meals in the bistro were not being served until 22.30 hours. we were tired from travelling so settled for a room service sandwich. nice gardens and pool area for the hotter seasons. Would return again if back in the area as good value for money.

Comfortable room. Nice grounds to walk about. Friendly service. Free parking. Swimming pool but too cold in January.
Convenient restaurant. Well what else can I say to make the 200 character minimum. We liked the place. If we come back to Elche, we will go again. Let me say that again, if we come back to Elche, we will enjoy staying at this hotel again. Quiet room.

Stayed here for 3 nights, where here for business so didn't spend that much time on the hotel but liked what i did see. The rooms was good size and clean, the breakfast was good and the restaurant next door was very nice to, Walking distance to the central part of the town so all in all had everything that we needed.

Booked the hotel from one of the many websites you can book from today and did not incl. breakfast, was glad i didn´t since it was more or less 5€ cheaper to buy when we arrived at the hotel.

Excellent hotel set in beautiful gardens & great pool area - lovely airy feel as soon as you walk in - tastefully decorated - friendly staff - good breakfast selection, though hot food limited to scrambled egg bacon & cocktail type sausage. A very enjoyable visit

titulo: Best relaxing stay in a long time!!!
conteudo:
We stayed here for one night and wish we could have stayed for another couple of nights!

The setting in a palm grove s relaxing, the beds were comfy (singles pushed together), the size was great, wifi was fast, AC was quiet and efficient, bathroom was great! Went for a swim in the pool, which was fun. dinner at the hotel restaurant was wonderful, but don't have any tapas before you go because the portions are huge. Parking is covered and fenced and very reasonably priced. There is a mini-bar fridge that is big enough to put some of your own stuff into, like drinks and leftovers from the restaurant.

The breakfast is reduced if you buy it at check-in, and is very nice (and a good deal)!

There seems to be a nice set of rooms that would be adequate for a small conference, if you need to organize one! You can walk to the city center without much difficulty.

If I have a chance to return to Elche/Elx, I would definitely stay at the Jardin Milenio again! Since I normally like variety and trying different places, this is a high complement!!

Stayed here for a very relaxing week. Staff were very friendly and offered a good level of service.the bar and dining area were soulless and purely functional and didn't encourage lingering. The separate restaurant by the pool offered far better food and atmosphere. The pool area is very good with a choice of loungers or table and chairs for relaxing. Would definitely stay again.

titulo: Second rate guest at full price
conteudo:
We arrived late saturday night and were checked in rather quickly, got directed to our room which was clean and neat, albeit a bit dated. We were awoken rather early by the scuffling of large furniture down the hall and the feeling of our rock hard and lumpy beds.

Apparently it was in the middle of some spanish family holiday, where the younglings are celebrated, like a confirmation of sorts. This ment the hotel was filled to the brim with non-staying guests and almost all ammenities and services were closed.
The restaurant was off limits, the bar was dedicated to the party guests and the pool, gym, sunroof and everything alike was closed off.
We were instead appointed to a small seat in a less than sunny courtyard, right next to the playground where the kids of the party guests were understandably playing around.

I understand that hotels have parties and banquets, but we were not offered a discount or any form of notice. But instead asked to pay full price for access to close to no ammenities. So much for a relaxing holiday.

elche is a wonderfull greeen historical city and this hotel is the perfect stay receppie in the midle of beautiful garden
rooms are big and clean
the place is silent and the food decent.
i am visiting this place twice per year because I have business in the area and I do recomend

We stayed three nights there recently on vacation. This is off season but the weather was great and this hotel is in a perfect location if you like to walk around the sights of Elche. It is a little cheaper than the better known Huerto del Cura, but it is owned and operated by the same people. It hit the high points for my needs in a hotel: clean, comfortable bed and good shower. If fact, this was one of the better showers I've ever experienced. Pressure was so great you actually had to turn the water down. Beds are very firm, as they are throughout Europe, but it was comfortable. The room was very clean and the service staff was very friendly.

This hotel is a little difficult to find if you don't know your way around, but it is located in a protected area of the Palm Tree forest. It is an easy walk into town and all the sights. The small train that takes tourists throughout the city has a stop just steps away from the front door.

There is adequate parking and some of it is covered. And the breakfast is excellent. Includes cooked eggs, sausage, fruits, cheeses, and excellent pastries and fruit juices. We enjoyed it very much. We didn't try the hotel restaurant, but it is in a beautiful setting and looked very nice.

Hotel also has excellent free Wi-Fi.

We arrived after a very long car journey and were very greatful for the comfy beds and good shower. Enjoyed a late afternoon swim in the pool, wasn't too busy and transats were reasonably clean.
The rooms were large, air conditioned with a mini fridge (very useful), the only drawback was that the bin collection was around 5.30am, noisy and just underneath our window!
Breakfast buffet was good, it had a very large choice.

titulo: Excellent hotel- but bring a phrasebook
conteudo:
This hotel is extremely clean, quiet and efficient. The rooms were cleaned daily but the maids never disturbed us and were very friendly which was lovely.
Breakfast had a range of foods, some traditional Spanish breakfasts, pastries, yoghurt, fruit, cereals..cooked stuff was just boiled egg, scrambled egg and bacon which had been sat out and wasn't great, but all the other food was lovely anyway.
The pool was really quiet and clean, the pool food was lovely and service excellent; just had to call from the phone by the bar and they came straight away!
The La Taula restaurant was absolutely delicious- the set tapas menu was very reasonably priced and had a huge range of really interesting food.
The hotel is a very short walk from the town centre where there is a range of shops, bars and restaurants- but bring a phrasebook or do some translating beforehand as almost no one speaks english!
Recommended: Lazarran Restaurant and Datil de Oro restaurant
Overall a very quiet and relaxing holiday, not tourist-y in the slightest but still friendly and interesting!

titulo: Relaxed, clean, friendly and close to the town
conteudo:
This was a last minute trip, and we really fell on our feet here. hotel is clean, quiet and we couldn't fault the staff. Pool was quiet for our stay, sometimes we were the only ones there. Pool food was superb, and service excellent, once you let the staff know you wanted something.

Just a few minutes walk from the town centre which has many different bars and restaurants to choose from. A vibrant square with lots going on at night. Definitely worth adopting the Spanish way of eating around 10pm to become immersed in the atmosphere.

titulo: Lovely quiet hotel...but don't expect anyone to rush!
conteudo:
Stayed at this hotel for a week and had a really lovely holiday. It is a very quiet and peaceful hotel and the vibe is very chilled and laid back. I think it would make a great hotel for couples - bit too quiet for kids I think.

The room was large and clean and the air con (much needed) was efficient. There was a small mini bar and the bathroom was spacious and clean. The all-important shower was hot and strong.

The real highlight of the hotel is the pool. Shaded by palms and with nice warm water, there are a few tables by the pool where you can eat lunch.

The hotel is a short walk from the town centre where there are lots of bars and restaurants (to be honest not all that great a choice of food) and again, a very friendly safe vibe.

Please don't expect to speak English at this hotel (or in the town) as only the recptionist spoke English. The waiters spoke not one word so arm yourself witha few phrases!

Downsides? The service is VERY slow. Long wait for a waiter by the pool. Long wait to even get a menu in the restaurant! So patience is a virtue

Also, the loungers by the pool are TERRIBLE! really uncomfortable and a lot of them broken. Time to get some new ones!

titulo: A nice quiet calm peaceful hotel
conteudo: First city break for a while and we were surprised with how good Elche is to visit - and cheap as well. The hotel - Jardin Milenio - is well staffed and friendly and most importantly, clean. It has large rooms and is situated in a nice spot with an easy stroll into town. Good food & great value.

titulo: If you want to relax ... Go to this hotel
conteudo:
My daughter and I travelled to Elche to visit friends. I am pleased to report that this hotel is consistently excellent. We did book last minute and got a really good deal. The hotel is very clean, good air con and very friendly helpful staff. I agree with jksiv the pool is the star of the show, never too busy, always clean and a handy G&T to make the experience complete for me! Breakfast is very generous and the lunch served by the pool is lovely, very casual but with nice table cloths and formal waiter service. Elche is renowned for it's 1000's of palm trees, it's a very Spanish city, which for us is the attraction (no 'tea like mum makes' here thank goodness!). The seaside resort of Santa Pola is only 20mins by car or bus if you want the beach. I would recommend you visit the Plaza Santa Maria, beautiful architecture and lovely selection of Tapas bars etc. plus the world flagship Zara is just around the corner! It's in an old theatre and they have kept some of the features, they are open until 9pm so worth a visit.
Worth a try is Lizarro which is on the corner opposite the Basilica , in the evening they serve 'pinchos' small pieces of bread with cold (get from inside) and hot (they will come and offer them to you) toppings...very nice! You pay by keeping the small sticks and declaring them when you pay your bill. Or hop in a taxi and go to Sansano's the best tapas in our opinion and they have a couple of menus with English translations. I would say this is not a hotel for families with very small children, or if you like a lot going on. For us it's perfect and we would recommend.

First holiday without kids in 22 years and thought we would try an inland hotel. Generally we couldn't fault the hotel, helpful reception, clean rooms, air conditioning
which worked well, en suite bathroom, hair dryer supplied, mini bar if you wanted it.
The rooms were cleaned every day. The hotel is about a 10 minute slow walk in August from the city centre, the area swamped by hundreds of palm trees, so many, that after a few days you don't notice them. The food in the city is pretty basic, unless you go for the high class places. You will find a couple of Irish bars and 1 Scottish bar with not an Irishman or Scot in sight unless they happen to be customers. Plenty of Tapas bars. I would stress the food isn't bad, just limited choice. If you decide to go, I would advise you learn some Spanish or take a phrase book with you as there isn't a lot of English spoken and menus are almost always in Spanish or other languages, but not English. There are a few, but not many. The train station is about a twenty minute walk, keep going past the information centre for about a hundred yards or so and turn right, Station is about 50 yards along. Arrive very early for your desired train as ticket machines didn't work and you will find yourself in a queue which moves at a snails pace waiting to purchase tickets. Trains go to Alicante in one direction and Murcia in the other. Back to the hotel, the food in the cafeteria and restaurant is apparently very good. We didn't try it but others said it was good. The star of the show is the swimming pool, never crowded, could have done with a few more sunbeds. In my opinion this is not a hotel for a family with kids because of it's quiet location, more suited I feel for couples who don't particularly want a beach holiday. Having said that I would highly recommend the hotel. I close with two little niggles, in case the hotel reads this, I booked a double room and pushing two single beds together does not constitute a double, which newlyweds wouldn't have appreciated, although we didn't fall into that bracket, and the second niggle is even more trivial. I had to ask several times on a daily basis for shampoo in the bathroom, which was part of the deal only to be given a couple of 20ml sachets which last for one shower each. So, overall conclusion, first class hotel, with almost nothing to fault.

We were a group of more than 30 people and we stood in this hotel for a weekend.
What I can say it's that the staff was great with us, specially during saturday night, as we arrange a dinner for all of us and they make all.gif best to give us a great meal
For the rest, rooms are pretty big, a little.but old furnished, but clean and comfortable.
Swimming pool, ok, you can bring your drinks from the bar.
It's very well located, but a .car it's needed to get there.

Had to collect people from airport early morning so decided to do a bit of shopping in Elche and stay here overnight. Elche was great for shopping, possibly better than Alicante.
All staff were friendly and helpful, hotel was clean and comfortable. Bedroom was functional, nothing special, reasonably large and with a well appointed bathroom. Hotel has a calm feeling to it and is well located; ten minutes walk from the old town and on the other side of the city to the shopping centres, industrial estates and the big shopping complexes.
Breakfast was good value.
All in all a good hotel, well positioned, easy to find and providing good value for money.

The hotel is as you expected. Good hotel, good rooms, nothing special but good service and friendly staff.
Good breakfast. Nice stay for a city visit but not a holiday feel. Parking on the premises but charge 6.50 which is not nessesary when you park in the restaurant area (was closed when we got there on a Thursday). The town has plenty of eateries so no need to stay at the hotel if you have a car. Good value for money, nothing spectacular.

titulo: Palms,water and comfort in the desert!
conteudo:
Palms,water ,confort after a long day in the desert!
Yes! Innthis part of Spain the view is mostly desert!We were here several times for business and returning to the hotel after a busy day is a blessing.
Rooms are large,nicely decorated with a local touch, very clean.
Stuff is welcoming you and the breackfast is authentical ! Have jamon and have a walk arround!

Stayed on October 18th for just one night. Flew into Alicante & waited 2 hours to get hire car, glad this hotel was nearby & easy to find. Appreciated the calm atmosphere & helpful reception staff. Room was fine, comfy & quiet. Evening meal in the lovely restaurant was superb. We were first ones in that evening (we're Brits!), so had undivided attention from the efficient waiter. Best meal we've ever had in Spain. Breakfast next morning also very good. Unusual place, it's a town full of palm tree gardens! Wished we could have stayed longer at this fab hotel.

titulo: Great hotel with top class food
conteudo:
We used this as an overnight stop due to its proximity to the main highway and reports of its great restaurant.

Very nice hotel, easy parking, large and pleasant double room and very friendly staff. But the restaurant was the starring role - someone who really knows his stuff in the kitchen.

A cheap breakfast compared to others (reduced to €8.50 if booked the previous evening) - the best we had on our 12 day trip through France & Spain - and with eggs and bacon, not just continental!

Highly recommended for a stop over.

titulo: Lovely hotel with a great pool
conteudo: We've stayed at this hotel a few times as we have friends in Elche. It is clean and friendly, lovely breakfast. The pool is never too busy with a bar and towels for guests, very relaxing. Would recommend.

titulo: The best for a simple reason...
conteudo:
...the best thing in elche is the palm tree garden..and the Jardin Milenio is just in the middle of it. You can take a walk in a really suggestive palm garden just walking out your room.
I travelled a lot to Elche for job and after different hotels I decided to come back always to Milenio. Rooms are clean, it's in the middle of the nature at 5 mins to the city center, there is a 20mts outdoor swimming pool, sauna and gym, the restaurant LA TAULA is a fantastic designed glass box in the middle of the trees, cool. Wi-fi is free. Parking outside on the road is suggested, you can save the parking hotel fees.

We’ve stayed at this Hotel several times and have always found the service to be good, the rooms clean and the pool wonderful. This year the service at the pool was rather slow, and there were rather a lot of flies, which although not the hotel’s fault is worth noting. Because this is a business hotel the pool is often very quiet… if you are lucky you may have it to yourself. I would recommend this hotel and will be returning.

We stayed here and at its sister hotel the Huerto del Cura; both are affiliate hotels of the Paradors and the excellent standards show: the food (La Taura), grounds, rooms and service were impeccable; only the location was better at the Huerto del Cura, although that was very good indeed too. There was a swimming pool too at both and plenty of parking. We had a great time at both and only switched because my partner is disabled and found the walk from the Hotel Huerto del Cura into town easier.

We found the name of the Hotel on tripadvisor on the net and phoned .Got a price quoted and booked.As we drove into Elche we followed the signs for the hotel, very clearly marked.Once at the Hotel we asked to change the room to a large bed instead of two smaller one .This was done at no extra charge.The whole Hotel smelled fresh and clean , the same as our room.The room being very spacious and with a large bathroom.The pool was large and clean and a welcome after a hot day on the road.We ate in the cafeteria were the service was impeccable like the food .In the evening we ate in the restaurant in the garden amongst the trees.Once again fod and wine was perfect as was the waiting team.The following day we ate in the cafeteria at lunch and restaurant in the evening again .Perfect as before ,we did not take breakfast in the hotel as we like the spain tosard's on the streetside cafe's.Personnel were proffessional, and most helpful and always ready to advise.The parking at 6 euro's a day was cheap for a guarded car park.All in all it was a wonderful stay with no hiccup's.
as someone said here the other guests were the one who were notvery correct , at five in the morning talking loud in the corridor show some peoples respect for other.Lucky we were already up as we left for the airport.Once again the wake up call was on time.All these little things go to make a wonderful stay and we fully recommend this hotel.Its position in Elche is perfect too.

titulo: Nice hotel, friendly staff, good location...noisy dogs!
conteudo:
My wife and I stayed two nights at Hotel Jardin Milenio in March and I must admit the place is excellent value for money.

Located 5 minutes walk from the town center and the Huerta Del Cura, opposite a peaceful palm grove, the hteol is clean and tastefully decorated, the staff are friendly without being patronising, our room was large and the rooms facilities (shower, mini bar, TV) worked perfectly.

Our only complaint would be that the rear of the hotel backs onto an area with several temporary buildings. The residents keep a number of dogs and the frequent barking kept us awake at night. So if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room that doesn't face the courtyeard.

The hotel is situated amongst the palm groves of Elche, a short walk from the centre of the historic old town, and also a short distance from the lovely gardens of the Huerto del Cura. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. The first night we had a problem with the next door neighbours who seemed to spend the night marching up and down their room but, after they checked out the following day we never heard a sound from the room.
We did not eat in the restaurant but did try a menu del día in the cafeteria which was excellent. The breakfasts were also very good.We found all the staff very helpful, particularly the waitress in the cafeteria who obligingly made sandwiches for my husband, who has a stomach problem, out of the normal kitchen hours.
The parking was reasonably priced and secure. All in all a very good hotel which we would both recommend and use again

The Hotel Jardín Milenio is close to the old centre of Elche. It is a modern hotel decorated and furnished in minimalist style, though its wipe-clean designer-style does give the public areas a slightly austere aspect.

The bedrooms are spacious, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms well-appointed. The windows have both shutters and double-glazing, so there was no external noise, but the door-closers were highly-powered, which meant that sometimes there was some noise of banging doors coming from the corridor. The television was Spanish Freeview, with no English channels, but there is free Wi-Fi.

We needed a meal after arriving quite late. Because the restaurant was closed for its winter break, we found that the cafeteria was serving a menu del dia at 12.5 euros, including drinks, which had a reasonably good selection of dishes and was efficiently served. However, there was only one waiter who spoke English and anyone with not much Spanish might struggle a little as there was no translated menu. In the morning there is an extensive breakfast buffet, though this is extra.

The staff generally were very friendly and helpful, everywhere was spotlessly clean and this hotel is clearly a firm favourite with the business community.

It is good value, too, at this time of year and makes an excellent base for touring the area.

titulo: Very nice hotel on the outskirts of Elche
conteudo: The hotel is situated in very nice grounds within the Palm Grove, from where it's an easy walk into town. There's a swimming pool, which I didn't use as it was quite cold. The rooms are modern and spacious, although they are not very well soundproofed as I could hear noise coming from adjacent rooms and the corridor. The staff are very friendly and the breakfasts are excellent by Spanish standards.

titulo: good hotel close to old town
conteudo:
We enjoyed a lovely large room overlooking the palm garden. There is a jogging track through the palm groves and the hotel has an outdoor swimming pool. A good breakfast was served in the coffee shop and a glass of sparkling carva and orange juice put us in the mood to explore Elche. By coincidence, we had arrived in time for Elche's colourful mediaeval fiesta which is held in the old town at the end of October and well worth a visit.
We spent a few interesting hours at the very excellent museum and took a walk around the botanical gardens. Tasty tapas are served at the restaurant de Paris in the old town.
If returning to Elche, we would stay again at the hotel Jardin Milenio

We stayed at the millenium hotel in october wih our kids. We were visiting family for an event and found the hotel charming, quiet and clean.
The reception staff were lovely and very helpful.
Our room was spacious and modern. Our kids' bed setee could have been bigger but it made no difference as they slept well.
The breakfast was abundant and based on local products, plenty of fruit and buns!
A very family friendly hotel.

Set in a forest of palm trees, our room looked out onto a courtyard. The hotel is immaculately clean and the rooms are huge. You can't beat it for value for money (only 70 Euros for a room) and everyone is charming. We stayed here twice in two weeks as we had to meet friends, however Elche itself is not the greatest place to visit and it can be confusing getting to the hotel, but it is worth it.

We ate in the restaurant which was just alright, nothing special. Breakfast in the cafeteria was alright as well.

Read the reviews and booked. Found the reviews to be totally accurate. Great value - very pleasant and relaxing. Pool amazing if short on sun loungers. Breakfast great and very pleasant staff - well worth the four stars. Not much in the town but Alicante close - so hire a car!

Fantastic hotel in the middle of palm gardens, we got the bus from airport and got off in elche town. Hotel well signposted, 15 min stroll. Taxi €18 recommend this for ease. On arrival warm greating, nice reception area with pc and free internet, and printer, handy for boarding cards. Rooms are placed over three floors with a lift. Our ground floor room was big with relaxing seating area, sofabed, looking onto a lovely courtyard. Mini bar, tv, free internet pc point, don't think WiFi.very big bathroom with traditional basket of accessories razor, toothbrush, comb etc. Crisp linen bedding, almost silent air con. Breakfast may appear expensive, but its the best spread I have ever had, served 7 to 11 each day. Attention to display detail is wonderful - boiled eggs served in individual glass on a red lettuce leaf. Lots different meats, cheeses, breads and fruits, fruit salads finely chopped are delicious. Hot and cold drinks, freshly squeezed Orange juice, chilled water and champagne, yes, champagne every morning. A lovely bucks fuzz to start your day. The swimming pool is just a short walk from hotel entrance, surrounded by jasmine, olive, orange and palm trees, spotless and very relaxing. Plenty sun beds, shaded areas, pool bar. Children's playground, small gym, monitors did not work but equipment fine if you needed yr gym fix. Bus stop into centre at end of road, stroll through palmarie opposite, or through footpath to left to small town area, local tapas bars, but be warned, not many places open until 9 pm, and on Sundays don't seem to open at all. Hotel has 24 hr room service, snack and a la carte menus. Prices reasonable and looked delicious. A delightful find, very clean and relaxing, worth every penny and will be returning again.

titulo: Perfect for a quiet week in the sun
conteudo:
We just wanted a quiet, hassle-free week in the sun and this hotel suited us perfectly. Despite being there in August the hotel felt very quiet and we were often the only people on the terrace, which is a lovely peaceful area to sit and read, surrounded by palm trees (as you are everywhere in Elche).
Everywhere felt very clean and I disagree with an earlier review about the air-con. On first walking into the room it seemed very stuffy but it turned out the air-con only works when the key-card is installed - after that we found it to be very efficient and needed a blanket at night.
The food we had was pretty good - great choice for breakfast and lunch by the pool was excellent.
My only real grumble would be the lack of sun-loungers around the pool - there are only 12 which for a hotel with 70+ rooms is pitiful.
Only 15 minutes by taxi from Alicante airport and a 10 minute stroll into town, where there are plenty bars and cafes. Do not go to Flashpoint cafe in the main square - it is truly awful (the name should have warned us) - tried to pass off chips & ketchup as patas bravas.

Hotel is located in the Palmetto area and a few minutes walking distance towards the center of town. Very nice and spacious rooms. Breakfast very good. Overall dining very good. Pool also nice, though no pool service really.
Only problem is if you have light sleep. Neighbours dogs pretty loud barking early morning.

We stayed there for one night only. We had a standard double room. We found the room too dark and the color of the tiles created a serious doubt on the cleaness of the room. Poor AC system. and we heard dogs barking all night We had diner in the cafeteria and the food was ok. Breakfast was good for 8 euros. The pool was nice but did not open at 10h00 as scheduled. Lack of service at the front desk. In summary it was acceptable for 76 euros.

Stayed here for the final 2 days of a 4 day trip to Elche (first few days spent at Hotel Del Cura- same chain). I preferred Hotel Del Cura which was slightly more expensive but worth it in my opinion as the rooms and pool area are nicer.

Rooms were clean but could do with a refurb. I was dissapointed there was no balcony to sit out on.

Pool was pleasant enough but dire shortage of sunbeds so some people had to resort to lying at the side of the pool on a towel.

Breakfast was pretty decent and included in the price we paid. The food and service at the restaurant (served on the terrace by the pool) was absolutely impeccable. Had the most delicious zuccini soup and paella.

Elche is great for a few relaxing days in the sun with good bars and tapas places nearby. Only 15 minutes away from Alicante airport so a hassle free holiday without the usual hoardes of tourists you get on the costas.

This is a beautiful hotel, spotlessly clean, quiet, good location for access to centre. Hotel staff very helpful. We were room only basis, but paid for breakfast 2 days - well worth it, lovely selection. Also ate in bar 1 night - good food, not too badly priced. Elche is a lovely place, the gardens a must see! As previously stated by a reviewer Restaurant Yaho - stunning food and a bargain as well!

titulo: Delightful hotel from which to explore the Palmeral de Elche
conteudo:
Stayed here for 3 nights and were thrilled on arrival to be given a lovely spacious, bright room with views over the garden and courtyard.

The hotel was really well located, surrounded by palm trees, yet only 5 minutes walk to the centre of Elche. We really loved the town, as it was totally un-touristy and you were experiencing the real Spain. The huerto del cura garden is smaller than I expected, but definitely worth visiting. 'There are some lovely buildings and museums to explore, and I would recommend climbing the church tower of the Santa Maria Basilica, from where the views over the city and its setting amongst the palm groves can be appreciated.

Also worth visiting is the coastline close to La Marina where the beaches are very quiet, and backed by lovely sand dunes and pine trees. Close by in the Las Salinas natural park with lots of interesting bird life, including flamingos.

The hotel milenio has a fabulous huge swimming pool surrounded by palm trees and a very relaxing place to chill out.

The breakfast buffet at the hotel was super with a wide choice of fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals, breads, ham, cheese and even cooked eggs, bacon, sausages etc. The orange juice was freshly squeezed and delicious!

We found lots of lovely tapas bars in Elche in which to dine, but be aware that they mostly don't open until 8.30 or 9.00pm.

We found the hotel staff to be friendly and helpful.

All in all we enjoyed staying here so much that we returned later in our holiday and stayed another 3 nights!!!

titulo: Good location and very pleasant/clean hotel
conteudo: Only 5 minute walk to town, great, clean and pretty hotel. Staff were very helpful getting the computer (free use) to print off our boarding cards for the journey home. Room overlooked a pretty terraced area and the outdoor pool area was very nice too. Would stay again.

titulo: Simply a very pleasant hotel and a bargain
conteudo: Stayed for 2 days in July 2010 with our teenage son in a triple room. Pleasant interior and surroundings, right by Elche's huge palmtree park, and at walking distance from the center. The room was large enough with a very spacious bathroom, it was clean, it was air-conditioned. It had Wifi. Good parking facility. This hotel attracts business travelers and tourists on a short stop-over, like us. Breakfast buffet of good quality. One of the best things is the wonderful and enormous swimming pool. For a brief stay this hotel is an excellent choice. Incredible value for money!
The hotel was clean, the rroms were spacious, the staff was friendly, and the restaurant was fantastic. Best rice dishes in the world!

THis was a really nice hotel. Very walkable to town but not in the heart. Just a quick 5 minuate walk which was nice. Breakfast was very nice. We had some conference meals while staying here and even though they were serving a large group the food was excellent. Our room was nicely furnished, good bed and nice size. Bathroom was very nice and large. Shower was great.
They have free internet access in the lobby. Easy to use. The pool is a great lap pool and it was so nice to do laps around 7PM. We also enjoyed the town. It has enough going on but is not big. We walked to the other side of town and had a great mean at El Granaino (phone 96 666 40 80). I would recommend--we were 8 and had a great meal at a large round table. We walked there and back. its about 15 minutes and was lovely.

titulo: Perfecto para una estancia los días que se quiera
conteudo: Excelente en todos los aspectos que tiene que tener un hotel, por su puesto que todo se puede superar pero en mi caso no tengo queja de absolutamente nada, todo muy bien, incluso las comunicaciones. Totalmente recomendable.

Tras la nueva remodelación ha quedado muy confortable y agradable. Habitaciones muy bien y la atención y servicio estupendos. Bien comunicado por su situación tanto para ir al centro de la ciudad como a poblaciones cercanas. Ideal tanto para viajes de negocio o de vacaciones. Precio calidad muy bueno.

Estaba visitando Elche y yo decidí quedar aqui una noche. Me dieron las llaves en seguida. La habitación era pequeña con cama doble pero suficiente para una persona y baño portatil. Decidí pedir una pizza carbonara pero estaba con más grasa pero el sabor no estaba mal. La habitación estaba equipado con la tele y airecondicionador perfeto para dia calurosa. Para el precio que page yo, en mi opinion estuvo bien.

Posiblemente el hotel Ibis de Elche es el mejor de todos los que hemos estado y hemos estado en bastantes, tanto en España como por Europa. Por su modernidad, los servicios que ofrecen o la amabilidad y trato de sus empleados. Felicidades!!!

titulo: BUEN HOTEL PARA HACER ESCALA O IR A VER EL FUTBOL.
conteudo: Hice parada en este hotel después de un largo viaje y para continuar al día siguiente. Los accesos de entrada y salida al hotel están muy bien. Las instalaciones están bien y es curioso el baño modular dentro de la habitación que cumple ampliamente su función. Fácil y gratuito aparcamiento delante del hotel. Inconveniente es que está alejado del centro de la ciudad pero si es para hacer escala o ir a ver el futbol, ya que el estadio Manuel Martínez Valero está a cinco minutos andando, es perfecto. Recomendable por lo anterior dicho.

Excelente ubicación, buenas medidas Covid19 y excelente atención del personal. Servicios mínimos garantizados a pesar de las restricciones que te hacen sentir cómodo y seguro. Volveré sin duda alguna.

Llegue al hotel a las 22.10 h después de 1000 kmts y me dicen que tienen cerrada la cocina. Les digo que al estar hospedado me pueden dar de cenar, o hacer un bocadillo, u me dicen que tienen orden de la dirección del hotel de a partir de las 22 h no servir nada a nadie. Es lamentable, que esperas cenar en el hotel porque por el toque de queda no hay otro sitio, y te dejan tirado. Que vergüenza, podrían aprender de los IBIs Bonaire o Murcia, que los días siguientes me atendieron y sirvieron muy bien por la noche.

Viajé por negocios desde Panamá hasta Elche,el trato en el hotel por parte del personal fue mas que excelente,te hacían sentir como en casa,un lugar maravilloso para trabajar y para conocer esa maravillosa ciudad.
100x100% Recomendado.

Fué una visita algo fugaz, por trabajo, pero me sentí como en casa.Habitación amplia y luminosa, limpieza, ubicación y atención de 10. Cuando tenga que volver a Elche, Alicante.. sin duda repetiré.

Recomendable al 100%.

Hotel práctico, limpio y cómodo. Bien ubicado y calidad precio genial. Personal amable y servicial. La comida muy buena. Lo que más nos gustó es la tranquilidad en la habitación.
Lo recomiendo para hacer una visita a Elche y sus playas.

titulo: Espectacular atención, personalizada y consecuente con la situación.
conteudo: Dadas las circunstancias de pandemia que vivimos es muy de agradecer el trato personal impecable de los trabajadores del Hotel Ibis. Se nota el cuidado del detalle en todos sus gestos y el firme compromiso con los clientes. Limpieza, protocolos anti COVID-19 y una organización excelente de los circuitos en el hotel lo hacen la mejor opción sin duda para alojarse en el entorno del Parque industrial de Torrellano. Aportan su granito de arena para que el país pueda salir de esta nefasta situación.

Espectacular trato, desde que haces el checkin en recepción hasta que te marchas.
Decoración muy correcta, acorde al hotel de cadena que es, pero con un autentico y genuino toque moderno y acogedor en la zona de la cafetería. Si estas pensando visitar Elche, ya sea por ocio o trabajo elige bien y esta es la mejor elección.

Por mi actividad comercial, conozco bien muchos hoteles, ayer dormimos en este hotel, que en principio yo le tenia un poco de mania, al ser un hotel que la habitación me recuerda un poco al estilo de las caravanas.
Solo un pero....la almohada....por favor, poner alguna más en la habitación, es que son tan finas, que tuve que ponerme el edredón debajo de la almohada, por lo demás...perfecto.
Y para finalizar, ENHORABUENA AL PERSONAL, que amabilidad....!!!
Este Ibis, si es recomendable

Zonas comunes nuevas, habitaciones reformadas y personal profesional y amable, qué más se puede pedir?
Mesas de trabajo ideales, todo el fútbol en el bar y se puede cenar tranquilamente.
La mejor opción de alojamiento para mis viajes a Elche.
Gracias por hacerme sentir como en casa.

todo muy bien como siempre, el personal muy amable y muy atento, ya hemos estado varias veces y nos gusta porque tiene en el mismo edificio mercadona y muy cerca mcdonalds, kfc, burger king, wok, pista de patinaje, y las diferentes playas están a 15 minutos.... pudiendo elegir a cual quieres ir. Alicante tb queda muy cerca

Hemos pasado una noche mi marido y yo y ha sido una experiencia muy recomendable. Recepcion agradable y con cerveza incluida de regalo. Precio muy economico (52euros). Cama, tele y duchita. Todo limpio y muy acogedor.

titulo: Vulneracion de mi derecho a la proteccion de datos personales
conteudo:
Le facilitaron a una persona ajena a mi entorno , ni familiar , ni amigo ni absolutamente nada que ver conmigo salvo que su hija y la mía juegan a waterpolo juntas TODOS mis datos personales, la reservas que tengo a mi nombre en su hotel, que tenia dos habitaciones, fechas de entradas y de salidas, que no había cancelado ninguna y absolutamente TODOS MIS DATOS , vulnerando mi privacidad y sin ningún tipo de autorizacion por mi parte)
La jefa de recepción de esa tarde 8 de febrero inicialmente se niega a darme su nombre cuando le pregunto por director del hotel.

A la queja que he puesto a la cadena hotelera de Accors Hoteles me responden mediante un abogado que eso no es vulnerar mis derecho a la intimidad.

He vuelto a reclamar y nadie me da una contestación,

Es totalmente ilegal que nadie facilite ningun dato de mi reservas hoteleras ni si quiera se confirme si voy a ir a Elche o no.

titulo: Bien a pesar de las obras
conteudo: Tras la reforma este hotel quedara mucho mejor, más agradable. Hay que aguantar las obras porque el resultado merecerá la pena. Por lo demás prestaciones tipo Ibis. Sugiero ampliar la variedad y calidad del desayuno.

Nos alojamos muy a menudo en los hoteles Ibis así que ya sabíamos cómo son y que con los Ibis no suele haber sorpresas desagradables. No hay lujos pero todo está bien en líneas generales: la limpieza, el servicio, el desayuno. La ubicación nos gustó ya que es fácil llegar y aparcar. Al centro se llega caminando 20'

Excelente alojamiento, gran comodidad, perfecta limpieza del cuarto y baño, personal agradable, buena ubicación para ir a la universidad Miguel Hernández, con parada de bus enfrente del hotel. Wifi perfecto.

Hotel situado en un barrio muy tranquilo. El hotel esta muy bien equipado y limpio. La caña es muy cómoda y la tv bastante grande. Se encuentra aparcamiento fácil. Dispone de bares alrededor y de un supermercado. Muy bien comunicado.

primera visita en familia a este hotel tras estar en algún otro de la cadena,personal amable,checkin rápido y ágil,buena ubicación habitación limpia y funcional,facil aparcamiento y zona nueva con establecimientos de hostelería cercanos,descanso perfecto y silencioso,calidad precio excepcional de esta cadena

Pasamos algo mas de una semana este verano por las vacaciones a última hora, ya que nuestro plan era ir a portugal, pero por la huelga de transportes tuvimos que cancelarlo. El parking casi siempre estaba lleno y te tocaba aparcar fuera. El desayuno, la verdad bastante rico y con varias opciones, entre ellas leche de soja y avena, bien para las personas que sean veganas. El problema que tuvimos fue que el aire acondicionado hacía mucho ruido y al dormir era molesto (depende de lo que te cueste conciliar el sueño). Finalmente, aunque el problema no se solucionó, acabamos contentos por el trato de los empleados ya que se desvivieron por intentar arreglar el problema. El precio, igualmente, muy caro para la calidad que ofrece. No tiene neverita. La limpieza era buena. Si te toca al lado del ascensor, oyes todo.

titulo: Comodo, limpio y personal muy amable
conteudo: Como en todos los hoteles del grupo en los que hemos estado, la atención ha sido siempre perfecta. La habitación muy limpia y bastante amplia y silenciosa. El buffet, muy completo. En definitiva, muy recomendable para su categoría.

Personal atento y profesional, habitación amplia, limpia y comoda,Desayuno correcto, restaurante bueno, parking en el hotel aún precio razonable, sin duda volveré a hospedarme cuando esté en Elche, la situación no excéntrica pero se encuentra en una zona llena de comercios

titulo: MUY BUENA RELACION CALIDAD PRECIO, personal atento y educado, instalaciones limpias e impecables
conteudo: MUY BUENA RELACION CALIDAD PRECIO, personal atento y educado, instalaciones limpias e impecables, muy recomendado para estancias cortas al mejor precio y bien situado con buen acceso y fácil comunicación con la ciudad. Muy recomendable. Gracias.

La verdad que lo escoji por casualidad, solo estuve una noche, pero es super tranquilo, esta un poquito a las afueras, pero en coche a menos de 5 minutos del centro, y un personal de recepción muy amable. También dispone para quien quiera de desayuno.Tambien dispone de aparcamiento gratuito. No es la primera vez que escojo un ibis ni será la ultima.

Cuando digo excelente, me refiero en mayor medida a su personal, bien humorados, serviciales y muy atentos.
Siempre hubo una posibilidad de estacionamiento en el entorno,
Estrategicamente ubicado, a 8 minutos del centro de Elche, también el aeropuerto y Alicante estan en las cercanías.
Los cuartos con ventanas doble vidrio aislan con exito el ruido callejero. Tampoco fue molesta la respiración del aire acondicionado y el extractor de aire del baño, que funciona permanentemente no molesta cerrando la puerta.

titulo: Sencillo y simple, acorde con su categoría.
conteudo: Hiciste un Hotel de dos estrellas esto es lo primero que tienes que tener en cuenta y, por tanto, no esperes mucho más que dormir y tener un sitio donde poder estar tranquilo la habitación. Estuve alojado en una habitación doble y, la verdad, es que es muy sencilla. El baño es un móvil incorporado a la habitación. Prefabricado una sola pieza. En mi opinión un poco demasiado justo sobre todo teniendo en cuenta que es una habitación doble. No perdamos de vista que son las estrellas. En cuanto al desayuno, que teníamos incluido, muy, pero que muy justo. La cama no era muy cómoda, especialmente la almohada. Por el precio no se le puede pedir más

Excelente pelo atendimento,servicio, limpeza y qualidad e precio
Podreia funcionar la cocina por la noche en el sábado y domingo
La ubicación y parking buenos
El desayno muy bueno también con suco de naranja natural

El hotel cumplió sobradamente laa expectativas. Habitación muy cómoda y limpia. Desde el hotel hicimos visitas a las playas, a unos 15 kms, y justo tienes varias salidas al lado, con lo cual no hace falta pasar x la ciudad. El personal muy atento y amable. Repetiría sin dudarlo.

He llamado para reservar la promoción de agosto desayuno gratis y me han dicho que no existe tal promoción. me han dado precio y es incluso más caro que en la página web normal.Lo que me ofrecieron es el precio con desayuno y precio sin desayuno cuando lo normal con la promoción que está anunciada en tripadvisor es que en el precio normal sin desayuno lo incluyese sin coste.

En general muy contento con mi estancia,la habitacion limpia y ordenada y con lo necesario para estar agusto.
En cuanto al desayuno bien pero con matices,el tostador muy pequeño,el cafe muy malo,en surtido poco en fruta de lo demas hecho en falta bacon y huevos revueltos.
Pero en reglas generales muy contento con el hotel y servicio,volveria a reservar este hotel.

Es un hotel modesto a muy buen precio. La profesionalidad y eficacia de sus empleados es magnífica. Es un hotel para pasar una o dos noches como maximo. Buen aire acondicionado, y magnifica tv en la habitacion. Colchon muy cómodo y parking en el edificio a 6€ el día. Que más se puede pedir?

Hotel muy recomendable, la habitación confortable, todo muy limpio tanto la habitación como las zonas comunes, el cuarto de baño mas bien pequeño, cama king size y de colchon confortable, el personal de recepcion muy amables.

Está a las afueras de Elche, reformado y de aspecto moderno. Las habitaciones muy pequeñas y el baño de juguete, parece el de una cabina de avión. Yo reservé una triple y la cama de la niña salía de la pared, incomodisima. Las dos noches que pasé nos toco bajar los dos días a pedir toallas pues nos dejaban sólo una, también papel higiénico porque al limpiar no lo ponían, un poco desastres la verdad, sin embargo el personal muy amable y la habitación muy limpia.

Buena relación calidad - precio.
Los trabajadores muy amables y profesionales.
En general todo muy agradable.
El desayuno sin pretensiones pero suficiente y muy bueno.
Hotel tranquilo sin jaleos
La limpieza genial.

Relación calidad precio muy buena, atención estupenda, limpio, agradable y lo más cómodo sus camas. Viajo con frecuencia a Elche y suele ser mi primera elección. El desayuno está muy bien, con variedad y calidad.
Por poner alguna pega, diría que el aire acondicionado de las habitaciones hace demasiado ruido para mi gusto.

Un hotel en la línea de Ibis:
BIEN: Muy buen precio, buena limpieza, aspecto general del hotel, y reformado
MAL: habitaciones muy compactas en las que a duras penas cabe una cama adicional y algo alejado del centro.

Yo he ido a muchos hoteles de españa y de la zona de valencia y alicante, y nunca jamas he encontrado con algo tan malo, el baño es portátil, habitación super simple, personal super desagradable y un desayuno que no le daría ni un 1.

Hotel moderno, funcional y práctico, servicio eficaz con gente joven y cualificada. El desayuno rico con productos varios, para todos los gustos, cómodo de servir y de tomar.
Para una escapada recomiendo el Hotel Ibis por su relación calidad-precio

titulo: Hotel con habitaciones renovadas y dog friendly
conteudo:
Durante nuestro viaje a Elche nos alojamos en este hotel cuyas habitaciones han sido renovadas recientemente y destacan por la limpieza y la comodidad de la cama (según mi humano). También nos encantó el diseño del baño, una especie de cápsula que parece sacada de una nave espacial. Quizá a alguien le parezca pequeño, pero este original baño tiene lo indispensable y está impecable.
El hotel está en un barrio a las afueras de la ciudad, pero se encuentra rodeado de parques y andando a 5 minutos hay una enorme zona de esparcimiento vallada donde los perros podemos correr a nuestras anchas. También hay varios centros veterinarios en el entorno del hotel con sus respectivos servicios de urgencias.
El desayuno es sencillo, pero de calidad. La verdad es que el hotel es perfecto para un fin de semana o tres días, con una buena relación calidad-precio. El coste de cada mascota por noche es de siete euros y no hay límite ni en el número de perretes por habitación ni en el tamaño. Además, podemos quedarnos solos, siempre y cuando nuestro dueño avise y deje su número de móvil en recepción.

el hotel está muy bien calidad precio, lo único que eché de menos es una bañera, pero todo lo demás perfecto. Menos la tele, que tardaba mucho en coger canales y el aire acondicionado que hace mucho ruido

Hotel básico, limpio, con cama muy cómoda y desde que lo han reformado quitando la moqueta y poniendo tarima y pintado está mucho mejor. La televisión la han puesto más grande y con smart, una pasada.

Hotel normalito.
Habitaciones estándar Ibis.
Limpias y con baño prefabricado.
Precio económico.
Dispone de Parking de pago 6€.
Hay varios sitios de fast food justo al lado además de un supermercado.
Cama bastante cómoda.
Habitaciones algo ruidosas por la carretera.

El hotel está recién reformado. Las habitaciones no son especialmente grandes, pero suficientes para estancias cortas. Resaltar que la cama es especialmente cómoda. La zona del hotel es más bien tranquila, por las afueras y comunica bien con la ronda. Tiene párking y muy buen precio.

titulo: El hotel, muy bien, el personal excelente.
conteudo: El hotel es muy cómodo. Cama, baño, almohadas, parking... Todo correcto. La diferencia radica en el personal,amable, atento, siempre preocupado por el confort del cliente. Me hicieron sentir como en casa.

Sólo pasamos una noche, ya que teníamos una boda y los salones estaban al lado. Cierto que nos alojamos muchos invitados y había de otra boda pero no hubo ni ruidos ni nada por el estilo. Barrio tranquilo con bares, sitios donde comer... EL lugar está bien situado, y más o menos como cualquier Ibis. Habitaciones limpias, cómodas, personal agradable y si un baño tipo como el de las autocaravanas pero espacioso y con todo lo que requieres para un baño. Para una corta estancia genial, y un buen precio.

Hasta la fecha es el Ibis más de batalla en el que estado, todo un poco inferior del nivel medio de ibis, lo mejor la tranquilidad y atención de los empleados y lo peor es que en este hotel se concentra huéspedes de bodas por lo cual es que de madrugada lían el follón.
Esta a las afueras de elche bien conectado para ir Alicante y Santa pola.

Hotel de ciudad muy bien situado ,cerca de de un centro comercial,un mercadona ,al lado bares para tomar algo ,habitaciones muy amplias ,la mía para tres adultos ,el baño muy coqueto,con placa de ducha .en general todo muy bien.

Excelente todo en este hotel ! Como siempre se ajusta a lo q pretendemos mi esposa y yo ! Práctico ! Rápido todo tanto el check in o el check out ! La limpieza ! La ubicación! La atención es excelente!

Gracias a la atenciòn recibida, a la calidad del servicio y a un precio asequible hemos disfrutado de unos dìas de relax en los que la llegada al hotel ha supuesto una alegría debido a la limpieza y orden. Tuvimos un pequeño problema con la iluminación y nos lo solucionaron al momento.Repetiremos

Hotel acogedor, con todas las comodidades y muy bien ubicado. Precio excelente y con facilidad de acceso a vías que en 20min o menos te dan acceso a bellas playas. El barrio donde esta ubicado el hotel, es bastante bueno, con locales de comida cerca y estaciones de servicio.

ole que hotel mas limpio agradable economico bien situado sorprendente de verdad y mira que llevo viajando bastante tiempo me dejo alucinado este hotel sisi esa es la palabra alucinado no se lo piensen en visitarlo

Hotel acogedor, habitación confortable para tres personas, la cama y almohada muy buenas, relación calidad precio muy bueno. la zona donde se sitúa el hotel muy tranquila. Fácil acceso desde la autovía.

La habitación es muy muy pequeña... casi no tiene armario y el cuarto de baño es un módulo como el de los hospitales... el precio fue 50 euros la noche que está bien.. pero la habitación la verdad deja mucho que desear

Personal amable(sobre todo el de limpieza),la habitación era pequeña pero cómoda y limpia.
No me gusto que la televisión tenía inutilizable el hmdi y el usb...y el ruido al abrir la ventana se oyen mucho los coches y si cierras y pones el aire este mismo emite un zumbido poco agradable.

Hace 2 meses que reservamos para el gran día de la boda. Nos dijeron que llamáramos el día de antes para dejar todo zanjado. Ayer por la tarde estuve toda la tarde llamando y no cogían el teléfono, así que bajé aposta desde Alcoy para dejarlo todo listo.
Cuando llegue a recepción el chico que estaba no encontraba mi reserva,( tardo casi 15 min) . Y de un no está de repente era un lo he encontrado. Le dije que llame y que baje aposta desde Alcoy y me dijo al respecto que tenían problemas con el teléfono...un hotel...no lo entiendo.
Y hoy llego y tampoco estaba la reeerva cuando de repente nos dicen que es para el 21 de agosto. Si, un mes después..y con una boda el día de hoy, con el coche cargado de ropa, zapatos, maquillaje de mi mujer y menos mal que no tenemos hijos.
Después de que sale todo esto nos comenta la recepcionista que teníamos que tener el papel de wonderbox ( lo cogimos porque nos lo regalaron unos amigos el día de nuestra boda )....obviamente no lo teníamos...la pregunta es... por que ayer no se me dijo nada al respecto y el día, no, a horas de la boda pasa esto cuando ya se me confirmó el día de antes que estaba todo en regla?
Por último nos ofreció una habitación...obviamente viendo el servicio nos hemos ido a otro hotel aún pagando más. No lo recomiendo a nadie y a mi y a mi mujer particularmente nos han hecho una putada. No volveremos jamás y por supuesto ninguno de los míos.

Íbamos de camino a Cadiz e hicimos noche en el hotel. Las camas eran muy cómodas, las habitaciones muy limpias y el personal muy amable, sin pedirlo nos dieron las dos habitaciones juntas. Hotel bien situado y fácil aparcamiento

Buena relación calidad-precio. la habitación es cómoda, el baño es raro tipo cabina de caravana pero aún así es confortable. Les dejé un comentario sobre los enchufes que no hay cerca de las mesillas y en la época en la que vivimos cargados con mil aparatos tecnológicos se hacen necesarios.

titulo: OPCIÓN MUY INTERESANTE PARA ESTANCIA CORTA
conteudo:
Sencillo pero todo muy correcto. Los armarios son muy pequeños pero se trata de hoteles pensados para una estancia corta.
La amabilidad del personal es destacable.
Un precio muy interesante.
Alejado del centro.

Buen hotel. La habitación muy cómoda, colchón muy cómodo y baño amplio. El desayuno muy bueno también.
Nuestra habitación tenía vista al mar lo que le agregaba un plus.
El único inconveniente es la distancia al centro de Alicante. Puede irse al centro caminando pero lleva algo de tiempo. El transporte público que pasa por allí tiene una frecuencia de uno por hora o 40 minutos y deja de pasar a primera hora de la noche.
El hotel tiene estacionamiento sin cargo por lo que si se cuenta con auto, la distancia no es un problema.
La atención del personal bien, aunque parece que deberían ser más, ya que hacen los ingresos de los dos Ibis y suele acumularse gente.

Hotel bien situado y de fácil acceso a tanto desde la autovía como desde la ciudad.
Limpio y el personal muy agradable. Con respecto a las instalaciones sólo hay que mencionar que este tipo de establecimientos está creado para cortas estancias, viajes de trabajo y por lo tanto las habitaciones y el hotel en si no es que sea gran cosa.
Buen precio y calidad. Hotel de negocios o de paso, no se puede pedir más

titulo: Una buena opción para conocer Elche
conteudo: El hotel está muy limpio y casi nuevo. Fácil acceso a la ciudad y alrededores. La playa y Alicante queda a 20 minutos. Lo malo es que se necesita coche para desplazarte porque está lejos del centro, pero Elche es una ciudad pequeña con lo que llegas en cinco minutos al centro. No tiene dónde comer cerca, salvo el Mac Donald.

estuvimos una noche y la verdad es que el hotel esta muy bien, habitacion correcta y personal de recepcion correcto. Habia muchos chicos jovenes y armaban ruido pero el peronal intentaba que se comportaran. Por lo general, si estas de paso en elche yno quieres estar en el centro esta bien
origem: Nueva York, estado de Nueva York

conteudo: Hemos estado dos noches en el hotel y creo que ha sido una buena elección. Estaba muy limpio, son amables y el precio es muy competitivo. Esta en las afueras de Elche, pero andando al centro, con una niña de 8 años, tardamos 20 minutos. Tambien hay autobus al centro. Se aparca bien en la zona y gratis. Tienes alrededor tiendas y sitios para comer o tomar algo. Os lo recomiendo si no buscais lujos y si buenos precios

Si buscáis un hotel para solo alojamiento, es el ideal. Muy buena relación calidad-precio. A 25 minutos andando del centro y a 5’ en coche. Cama de matrimonio muy cómoda y grande. El baño puede parecer pequeño, pero es lo justo y necesario. Buena limpieza de habitaciones y personal amable. Por ponerle un pero, a la hora de la ducha, cuando ponía el grifo a la temperatura que quería, al rato salía hirviendo, la bajabas, y al rato salía fría, y así varias veces, pero bueno, tampoco era el fin del mundo. En general muy bien, cómodo, limpio y barato.

Estuvimos el fin de semana siguiente al 14 de Febrero y la verdad que el hotel ne decepciono. He estado en varios hoteles de esta cadena en Madrid, Burdeos y Barcelona y nunca me había encontrado un baño tipo caravana y una alfombra con manchas. Además no se podía regular la temperatura y pasamos mucho calor.

Destaca la amabilidad del personal.
Es un hotel muy alejado del centro. Pero se podría ir caminando y se tardarían unos 25 minutos.
El desayuno es bueno para ser un dos estrellas.
Es muy barato si lo reservas con tiempo.

titulo: Olor a tabaco cada rato en la habitación
conteudo: Pedí una habitación para no fumadores y creo que es por el circuito de la calefacción y aire acondicionado que a pesar de tenerlo apagado, cada cierto rato se oye un ventilador a lo lejos y entra olor a tabaco. Odio el tabaco y me está molestando tanto que tengo la ventana abierta. Una pena, no creo que vuelva en mis próximos exámenes a no ser que me den una habitación en la que no pase esto. Por lo demás es un hotel en una zona bonita, sencillo pero que cubre todas las necesidades. Precio asequible.

Bien situado, comodidad y trato del persona destacable. Fuimos a un concierto en un pabellón situado a pocos metros, y nos resultó francamente cómodo el poder dejar el coche justo enfrente del hotel y despreocuparnos por dónde lo dejábamos.

La habitacion era un poco pequeña para 3 personas, y gracias al personal del hotel pudimos desayunar todos, porque no entiendo que reservando una habitacion triple, para una pareja y una niña de 9 años, solo nos den dos desayunos.

Muy buena atención por parte del personal, desayuno buffet variado y habitaciones relativamente limpias. Lo único regular, el baño, que olía mal y el suelo estaba pegajoso. La relación calidad precio no está mal.

titulo: Otro más de la cadena de hoteles
conteudo: Hotel adecuado y justo para dormir , sin grandes lujos ni comodidades. Lo peor del hotel es ese olor a tabaco que tiene, habría que hacer algo por eliminarlo es muy desagradable. El buffet es correcto en calidad y variedad.

titulo: Un clásico cuando voy a Elche
conteudo: LLevo yendo a este hotel tres años y en él se está muy a gusto, el trao de los empleados es excelente, las habitaciones estan bien y una cosa buena es que no tiene los baños de camarote de sus homologos franceses.

titulo: Fácil, ágil y muy buena atención
conteudo: Los estándares de limpieza, comodidad y amabilidad de Ibis y la cadena Accor están asegurados en este hotel. El servicio y la atención al cliente son muy buenos. El checkin y el checkout rápidos y en la habitación se puede trabajar muy bien (wifi, enchufes para todos los dispositivos, etc...)

Estuvimos un grupo para asistir a un evento familiar en el palmeral de elche.
Se encuentra a quince minutos andando del mismo. Aparcamiento gratuito en la puerta. Precios cambiantes segun hora de llegada
Habitacion pequeña pero limpia y buenísima cama. Perfecta para visitar ciudad
Curioso el cuarto de baño que es un añadido dentro de la habitación. Reducido espacio y algo claustrofobico el baño
Silencioso y perfectamente atendido por el personal del hotel que fueron muy amables

el desayuno fenomenal, como en casa amplio y variado habitación suficiente y acogedora,
el servicio muy bueno, en recepción muy amables
ninguna queja. me sorprendió el horario tan amplio del restaurante

Muy bueno el servicio sin embargo, se les olvidaba hacer la reposición del jabón en el baño. El desayuno es completo y la atención en recepción también. Resuelven tus dudas y si hay alguna situación lo agilizan.

La limpieza del hotel y en particular de la habitación (502) muy buena.
La comida del rte 24h. Bastante buena. Lo mejor la amabilidad y el buen trato del personal a la par con su profesionalidad.
Muy bien seguid así.

Como todos los Ibis a los que he ido, es un hotel básico, sin lujos pero limpio y a buen precio. La cama muy cómoda eso sí. El baño es una especie de cabina dentro de la habitación pero está bien. Lo que me pareció excesivo es el precio del bufé, son 7,95€ y no es para tanto. Se puede aparcar bien en al zona y está a la entrada de Elche con muy buena comunicación en coche.

Estuvimos alojados una noche y la verdad que no podemos tener quejas. Tiene todo lo que puedes esperar de un ibis. La cama es muy cómoda, la ducha lo suficientemente amplia y el personal muy amable. Todo a un precio más que razonable!

El pasado fin de semana tuve la ocasión de disfrutar de una noche en este sorprendente hotel. A pesar de ir con el motivo de una boda y saber que dormiría pocas horas el descanso fue súper reconfortante ya que la calidad de las camas es increíble. Pero ya en el check in cuando la chica que nos atendió, por cierto muy amable y servicial, nos indicó que el desayuno que teníamos contratado era hasta las 12 nuestra reacción fue de felicidad absoluta. La habitación tiene todo lo necesario para una estancia y estaba increíblemente limpia y el baño aún más. Pero lo realmente me encantó fue el desayuno cuya presentación y calidad ya me dejó sin palabras. Gracias Hotel Ibis Elche por una gran experiencia. Seguro que nos volvemos a ver.

Cómo la mayoría de hoteles de esta cadena, ideales para estancias cortas y a un precio razonable. Camas muy cómodas, baño pequeño pero con todo lo necesario. Personal muy agradable. Un poco apartado del centro pero perfectamente ubicado, a 5 minutos aproximadamente con el coche. Mercadona en los bajos del edificio!!!

La cama cómoda, la almohada muy alta para mi gusto.La habitación estaba limpia pero tenía una mancha enorme en la moqueta que le daba un aspecto sucio. Está un poquito alejado del centro. El personal de recepción muy amable.

todo muy bien..... los hoteles ibis tienen unos juegos de sabana muy suaves y confortables al tacto, fenomenal la habitación doble con la nueva cama ibis supletoria, el baño muy funcional.. mercadona, mcdonalds, burger king, gimnasios, restaurantes varios, tiendas, Ewok, bazar chino, día, etc... todo a menos de 2-3 minutos caminando. algunos incluso mucho menos. bien situado para ir a la playa a santa pola o los arenales del sol. tb viene cerca del aeropuerto y de alicante capital, la autopista llega hasta 500 metros del hotel

Como todos los ibis. Eso es lo bueno que sabes a lo que vas cuando te alojas. Cómodo y limpio. Un 10 para el personal de recepción. Cuando llegamos ya no quedaban habitaciones de cama doble no fumadores y estuvieron a la altura reaccionaron rápido y nos arreglaron una q tenían montada como triple.
