The restaurant is nothing special, just convenient and benefiting from the hotel´s splendid setting. Much better to be found elsewhere in Elche. Breakfast is OK, one can sit outdoors.

The car park is spacious enough, even with the daily receptions I could always find a spot late at night.

Overall, I would go back and recommend.

We stayed here for 3 nights while in the area, the hotel has a very relaxing feel to it and the palms throughout the grounds are quite amazing.
We found the room whilst a little dated very comfortable and spotlessly clean,we would definitely like to return here again one day and therefore would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
.

We stayed only one night on business. This is a resort hotel with villas arranged around a garden setting. The rooms are very tired and outdated. The amenities in the room are more akin to 2 or, at best, 3 star standard.
My flight landed late so I arrived at the hotel after 1am. There were several other people checking in at the same time (they had probably arrived on the same flight). There was no-one to assist with luggage or to assist with finding my room, which was not easy to locate in the dark with the layout of the resort as it is.
The breakfast was very ordinary.
I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you secure it at a bargain rate.
On a positive note, the pool area looked very pleasant.

We primarily wanted to visit the botanical palm gardens and needed a one night stay before moving on to the rest of our trip. An internet search brought back this result in Elche. We figured, yeah, sure, why not? How casual of us!!! What a beautiful hotel. Cabanas (each room is generally a quarter of the large cabana structure) were nicely tucked in among palm trees and well maintained gardens. Roomy, clean, comfortable accommodations and nicely private. Buffet breakfast is served in an amazing setting. The actual botanical garden Huerto del Cura (The Priest's Garden) is about 400 feet away. (That's another review.) The hotel's pool (not only the structure but the social activity around it) was energizing. Tables and chairs or reclining loungers were plentiful. Table-side or pool-side bar service was phenomenal. Rooms were generally well equipped but the WiFi service (essential in this digital age) was absolutely awesome. Enough range and bandwidth to allow us to watch uninterrupted Netflix movies to our hearts content. This place is truly a relaxing respite away from it all. The bar is open late and massage and facial treatments are available. The town of Elche was a great diversion. Great collection of eateries to satisfy the gastronomic cravings for most if not all. A great social scene at night but remember, it starts late as is the custom in Spain. WE WILL BE BACK!!!

The hotel is well situated and the fact that bedrooms are in little bungalows makes it all. The bedroom was spacious and soundproof ( a wedding took place when we were there and we didnt hear any music..) . The breakfast was also very nice. The down sides are people and transats by the swimming pool ( but hotel cant do anything about people reserving them and not being there the all day) and the very expensive car park : 13€ per day ( although there is plenty of free parking in the narrow street of Elche if you don't mind a short walk). I would have liked to have a free bottle of water in the bedroom as it would be what I expect from a 4* hotel. Very nice place for a long weekend as only 20 min away from Alicante airport.

We spent two nights here in July as we were attending a wedding function. Most of our time here was taken up with things associated with the wedding and we didn't really get to enjoy the place to the full extent. However, the wedding and reception afterwards was perfect and the hotel made sure everything ran smoothly and efficiently.

A perfect setting for a perfect wedding with all the amenities to hand. The staff, the layout, the wedding arrangements were all spot on along with the food and drink.

Definitely recommended but a word of advice....spend more than two days here to really enjoy the hotel to the fullest.

Went into hotel for a drink and looked around gardens etc. Everything was so well set out, great place to hold weddings etc. Very clean, staff very helpful and polite. Would reccommend to friends and family.
origem: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

conteudo: We have recently celebrated our daughter's wedding at the hotel. We could not have chosen a more perfect venue. The staff could not do enough to make the occasion as amazing as it was, they went above and beyond what we expected from them. The hotel itself has beautiful gardens and a lovely peaceful vibe. The canapes served after the wedding ceremony and the food at the reception was first class; we also ate breakfast at the hotel the morning after the wedding and, again, couldn't fault it. We stayed in a family room with our two grandchildren; the room consisted of a huge bedroom with king size bed and an adjoining room with twin beds and a sofa. The room was spotless and simply, but stylishly decorated. A huge thank you to all the staff and also to the lovely Eva who conducted the wedding ceremony so beautifully. We will certainly be returning in the future!

What a beautiful resort.The grounds are very lush,green and well tended.The whole place,including the rooms spotlessly clean. Very comfortable beds.Friendly staff.We spent 3 nights there and relaxed completely. Even though it was high season there were enough sunbeds. It would have been a nice touch if a few sunbeds had been situated around the gardens,away from the pool,as well as around the pool.Elche is an interesting town.If you can tear yourself away from the hotel,take a look at the Huerto del Cura Garden diagonally opposite.Have relaxing walks in the palm groves,and also see the lovely Santa Maria Basilica. Thank you Hotel Huerto del Cura. We certainly hope to return some day soon.

An amazing place. Very tranquil and calm. Went with another close friend. We had a beautiful villa. Walk-in shower. Double basins. Towels are provided in the rooms. Pay a 10euro deposit at Reception and you can get a towel for the pool area. Paying 10euro at reception also pays for a lovely buffet brekkie. Hot pastries. Hot food. Continental. Pool is exceptional and clean. So refreshing following temps of 30deg+!! Take a left out of the hotel and about 10 mins walk is the supermarket Hiperber. Bought water, crisps/snacks, fruit and milk. Took my own travel kettle as love a cuppa in the morning and tea for our afternoon siesta! We went at the end of July. It was very quiet. There were a couple of weddings at the hotel, but this did not disturb our time. We went for peace. Read books. Listen to music and chill. We did that and more. The town is stunning too. Loads of restaurants and water fountains. Oh, bags and shoes..oh my....so beautiful and so cheap!!! A place we will definitely go back to. Well done Hotel del Cura - couldn't find a fault!!!

We stayed two nights in a bungalow under the Palm trees. Nice and clean room with bathroom, no kitchen or private outside area. Friendly Staff. Good restaurent and poolarea. Very close to Alicante AirPort.

I stayed 2 nights at this hotel with my daughter and was very impressed. We didn't want to tour Elche so we spent our time at the hotel and were not disappointed. The layout of the hotel with room blocks around the garden and sheltered by the wonderful palm trees works very well. The room was simply but stylishly decorated and a very good size. We ate both nights in the hotel restaurant - once outside by the pool and once inside. The food is to a very good standard but possibly a little overpriced for the quality. The wine list is good and very reasonably priced. We wanted to lie by the pool and read books all day and we were able to do so in pretty good comfort. The only big downside is that the loungers are too close together and no umbrellas - which in August is not ideal at all. The pool is great - very deep (up to 2.6m) and a good size so doesn't feel too crowded. Overall very good service and friendly staff. If you need a good quality bolt hole near Alicante airport (20 mins drive away) before heading home after a holiday in the area I'd highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is such a gem. Stayed here for 5 nights, leaving tomorrow. It is incredibly relaxing, the staff are lovely and very helpful, the town is just a few minutes walk with lots of shops and restaurants. The food is pricey at the hotel and adds up if your staying for a while but it is lovely. People thought we were in the Caribbean from the pictures, I can't wait to come back!!

We stayed here for 7 nights and it was wonderful. Lovely palm trees everywhere, very relaxing. Staff are friendly and helpful. We would stay here again if we are back in Elche that's for sure. Thanks for a lovely week

I have just landed back in the UK. I am missing Huerto del Cura already. It's very relaxing, the food is lovely, the staff is friendly, the rooms are nice and the palm trees are amazing. I can't wait to go back. This is a little piece of heaven hidden away in elche, I don't think anything could of mad our trip better. It is mainly Spanish but they cater for other languages, the palm tree orchid next door is a must see it's so tranquil. I will defiantly visit again and have recommended Huerto del Cura to al my family and friends

We stayed only one night sadly, but made the most of a late check out. As others have said, rooms are bungalow style, arranged around beautiful palms and bougainvillea. We found both rooms to be clean and modern. Reception was friendly and efficient, and the poolside bar was amazing!
The pool is the star, it's kept very clean and there are plenty of sun beds and shady areas too. Easy stroll into the centre of Elche. Breakfast is very nice, but a short stroll to the placa de la glorieta, brings you to several lovely cafes to enjoy toast and coffee at a fraction of the price.
To conclude this is a great hotel, good value for money and I heartily recommend.

This is the letter I wrote to the manager to which I have had absolutely no response

Dear Sir/Madam,

Please forgive me for writing in English, my Spanish is quite poor to express myself concisely, although as I live in Spain and I do speak Spanish. I have attached a google translated version below for your information.

Having just returned from your hotel today, after visiting the wonderful La Finca Restaurant nearby yesterday evening, I would just like to comment that I found your hotel a huge disappointment. As a “four star” rated hotel, I personally found the rating, description and photographs of the hotel to be very misleading and contrary to my expectations.

As a guest and architect, I found the hotel quite run down. The reception and restaurant areas were relatively acceptable but the rooms were a huge disappointment. The beds were comfortable, clean and fresh but I doubt that the bathrooms would even qualify for a two star rating with a rusty leaky radiator, loose taps, dirty grouting and a disappointing atmosphere overall.

I´m alway one to give positive feedback, as I have done to many hotels and restaurants, but I´m sad to say that on this occasion, with your hotel at least, I was very disappointed. I think my friends staying next door would also agree.

I live in an Urbanisation called Villa Gadea in Altea. We have a hotel adjoining, by the same name. It is a five star and cost merely €28 per night more than I have paid at your Hotel (also including breakfast) It is however in a totally different league!!

I could mention other minor disappointments, like the fridge didn't´t work and a heap of other things but I´ll just attach a few photographs for you to see and decide for yourself.

Thanking you for your attention.

Kind regards, from some very disappointed customers.

We chose Elche as a convenient overnight stop to break-up our drive from Cordoba to Valencia. After passing on a standard room (small, stark and unappealing) and on a superior (larger, stark and unappealing) room -- we upgraded to a wonderful Jr Suite. Spacious, well-appointed, with a luxurious large bathroom. The grounds are beautiful: big swimming pool, palm trees, flowering birds of paradise, winding brick walkways. Very good breakfast

I stayed in Elche for one night and chose Huerto del Cura as it fit well with the aesthetic I was after, I had spent two nights in Puerto de Alicante, Postiguet where the town is always hustle and bustle and really appreciated the calm of Elche.

The hotel is walking distance from town approx 5 minutes.

The grounds are spacious and green, the facilities are all very environmentally friendly.

Breakfast is alright I've had better but consists of meats and cheeses, pastries, eggs both scrambled and boiled, fruits, veg & cereals.

The upstairs rooms in the bungalows have bath tubs and the ground floors have wet rooms.

The televisions are hidden in a wooden wardrobe in every room and can be opened and closed at your leisure.

Every room has air conditioning which is vital on a warm summers night/day.

The swimming pool is quite deep, there's a children's pool which is 0.5 metres. The lowest height in the main pool is about 1.18 metres and as usually gradually gets deeper.

There's a restaurant onsite and also a terrace, I didn't use either unfortunately.

I also didn't use their spa facility but can only imagine how gorgeous it would have been.

Huerto del Cura is definitely a little bit of heaven on earth.

I will definitely be back!

Great location - friendly staff and helpful nice palms and gardens set off with a good swimming pool. Great quality food in a nice setting - nice base outside of Alicante close to town with shops and restaurants

Visited here for our 26th wedding anniversary and had a great time the hotel is lovely and the staff were really good especially Jesus who I think is the restaurant manager we had some small issues but they were dealt with swiftly and professionally if I had one small criticism it would be the romantic package which my husband booked for our special occasion I would have expected cava on arrival in the room and fluffy bathrobes and a secluded table for dinner as I felt there was nothing romantic about it but the food was lovely so I'm not complaining would definatley go again

We had a great experience, a peaceful place surrounded by exotic vegetation
Amazing dinner, and the people at reception very nice and ready to help
Us in everything we need, rooms are spacious and clean, the buffet breakfast is very good and we had it outdoors by the pool
Definitely we will return.

titulo: Peaceful hotel amongst the palm trees
conteudo:
I stayed here for 5 nights in late February with my elderly father. We had 2 rooms next door to each other in the lush hotel gardens. The rooms were lovely with a simple, but practical design and were very comfortable.

Breakfast was excellent with choices to suit all tastes. We dined here 4 times during our stay. The restaurant is sumptuous and definitely fine dining with delicious regional dishes, served by attentive waiters.

Elche is a lovely city and this hotel is the perfect tranquil base from which to explore it. Highly recommended!

Our friends held their wedding reception here and we stayed overnight. The hotel has an unrivalled location in a palm forest in the centre of Elche, we were welcomed with cocktails and canapes around the pool - perfect. Later we ate dinner inside and there was the usual disco afterwards. The service was excellent at all times. The accommodation is in the form of cabins in the grounds, not luxurious, but fine, the gardens are lovely to wander around the next day.

Location – The hotel is located slightly outside the town centre in a palm orchard, beautiful setting! Two or three minutes walking to the nearest supermarket, then five minutes to the town centre. It’s also easy walking to the bus station and trains, and even immediately next to the hotel there are cafés and little shops.
Rooms – Our rooms were in a block away from the pool area, near to the Spa Zen Garden. It was a bit of a labyrinth to get to the room but it’s a beautiful setting. The room was big with all the things you need, wardrobe, desk, chairs, hairdryer, toiletries, safe. We had to search for the plugs though for our electricals! The walls have pictures of palm trees to go with the theme, and our room got the sun in the morning so it kept cool all day. With the big shutter pulled as well it was really comfy to sleep in.
Facilities – We used the pool and the spa. You can hire towels at reception for 10€ deposit which is returned when you give your towel back. The loungers were comfy by the pool, and you could easily move them around in and out of the shade. The pool is also very clean and there’s a life guard on weekends. We also enjoyed the chill-out area next to the bar, comfy outdoor sofas in the shade and table service for a refreshing sangria!
Food – We didn’t have breakfast here, but we did have some lunches, the sandwiches were really nice and the accompanying cocktails were so refreshing. They also do crisps and olives as bar snacks which was great for lazing round the pool in the sun!
Staff – Everyone was very friendly but they did do the old Spanish trick of not letting you pay for things (taking ages to accept that you wanted the bill, then taking ages to bring it).

titulo: Third Visit and surpassed even the past two visits for excellent gourmet food
conteudo: We went for half board this time as the food last time was so excellent. We were not disappointed - it was absolutely superb! The chefs here are Michelin standard for sure. Fish, meat all excellently cooked and top notch presentation. On top of pleasant grounds comfortable bungalows this is a superior hotel and worth a visit. Very good access for disabled too

We were pleasantly surprised by the luxury of this resort tucked in the palm groves of Elche. The location is not far from city center, shops, and restaurants. The rooms are very comfortable and they provide very nice, welcoming touches. I would consider this a luxury facility however the price at the time of our stay was mid-range.

Great property in the middle of Palm forest. Very close to Jardin Huerto del Cura. We had a very nice bungallo. The territory is absolutely splendid.
The breakfast was delicious. I regret I didn't go to the restaurant. It opens at 9pm, which was late for me (restaurants in generally open late in Spain).
Very long check-in process, which was a turn-off after a long ride.

titulo: Very good location, attractive gardens, bungalows could be better
conteudo: The location was just right, obviously very close to the Jardin Huerto del Cura, the most attractive of all Elche's palm gardens, and a short walk from the historic centre. The hotel gardens are very well kept, and the whole setting is appealing, though less appreciated in mid-winter. We were somewhat disappointed to find, as we first entered the bungalow, a damp smell. We managed to counter this by using the very effective heating system. I am not sure it is a good idea for the bungalows to become covered with climbing and creeping plants, when there are already many trees and shrubs close to them. Service was helpful (a leaking basin was quickly attended to, though unsuccessfully), but I cannot comment further as we did not have either breakfast or dinner there.

Traveling w/o reservations, we basically dropped our finger in the center of Elche's palmeral and contacted this hotel. We knew nothing at all about the experience we were about to have. We arrived after searching the entire city [not because the hotel is hard to find, but because we arrived during a major festival that had the east side of the town cordoned off to traffic] and were quite surprised to enter through the stately gates to the private parking. The main hotel is smartly decorated and stylishly designed. The 'hotel lodgings' are out back, in the jungle, little bungalows that have 2-4 bedrooms with separate entrances. There must be 20+ bungalows scattered throughout the gardens. Our room was in the second bungalow. Except for neighboring noises that found their way through the walls, the room provided all our needs very nicely. We felt at home here, a warm light at the end of a pleasant garden path marked the place for peace and comfort.

I joke about the jungle out back only because one cannot prepare themselves for the transition to such a lush, verdant, exotic oasis as the Hotel Huerto del Cura gardens present to their guests. Across the street is the 'jewel of the palmeral', El Huerto del Cura national artistic gardens [go], but frankly, they have only a botanical leg up on the Hotel Huerto del Cura. The Hotel arrangement of pool, bar, cafeteria, restaurant and bungalows within their palm forest is perfect. The effect is Eden. The care and variety of the vegetation and garden grounds is exceptional.

The natural environment sets this hotel apart, but their restaurant makes a stay here an added pleasure. We dined here each night to superb food and drink, elegance, and expert service.

We are sooooooo glad to have discovered the Hotel Huerto del Cura. We will stop in Elche again, just to stay here.

This isn't strictly speaking a 'hotel'. It's a collection of cabins around some lovely gardens. That said, it is lovely. The rooms are ok, basic but comfy bed and nice bathroom but my group booked 3 separate rooms and two of them smelled a little musty. We went to the restaurant for dinner which was a bit weird, nobody finished their food, it was a bit too 'edgy' for us and I would class myself as pretty adventurous.

This is not a traditional hotel but a series of well-spaced cabins set in a UNESCO world heritage site of impressive palm trees. The accommodation is relatively simple and slightly dated but clean and comfortable. The gardens make it stand out from usual hotels.

Good and varied breakfast choices in poolside setting and excellent restaurant in the main building.

A memorable retreat.

we were there as a group of eight. we had lovely tapas for starters, perfect meat as main course and desert to indulge. the wine suited the dinner very well. staff was very attentive. the interior was laid back elegance. overall my
best elche dinner experience.

Well designed spacious room in beautiful garden, Nice outside bar and swimming pool and good restaurant.
Garden, room and facilities all expres a quiet and relaxed atmosphere.
Service in restaurant can be improved.

Stayed here for two nights at the end of our vacation this summer... The way from the coast makes you think Where is this road taking me?, but when you finally arrive to the hotel, it feels like you arrived to a small paradise. The check-in was smooth and friendly, the bungallows are really cute, very clean and optimal for a shorter stay. The gardens are just incredibly well kept, beautiful green all over... The pool zone is maximum chill, if you dont have kids jumping in-out of the water. We had dinner one night, ordered the degustation menu, which was good but not really worth it. The waiters do not speak english really, so it was super hard to get most of our orders right. We waited super long for our bill, but it never came so after a while we left, nobody bothered. The next day at check-out we found some items on our bill we never even consumed, plus the menu card says the set price includes taxes and charges, but the bill added additional taxes on it, what nobody could explain what it really was. The receptionist was super rude, she did not seem helpful with the invoicing or explaining additional charges at all...too bad I forgot her name, she could use some guest service training.

Stayed for one nite to attend friends wedding reception. Checked in earlier that day enjoyed spending some time by the pool even though it was a bit cold. The setting is amazing little bungalows doted around the gardens. The room itself was very beautiful with a large bed and plenty of room. Good air conditioning. The wedding reception was amazing. The food was gorgeous, the setting was very beautiful one of the nicest weddings have ever been to, every little detail was lovely. The disco was fab. Checking in and out straight forward staff very nice. Would definitely visit again

titulo: Happy to get away from English summer!
conteudo: Beautiful clean rooms, lovely pool. Pleasant staff. The locals are the people you want to speak to the locals they love the footy, it's great to have a conversation with them and have a bit of banter even with the the language barrier with food you can say it all with expression

titulo: A we'll run hotel in a lovely location
conteudo: The rooms, being in detached bungalows, are peaceful and you are amidst palms and shrubs in a well kept garden. Our sitting room and separate bedroom were spacious and the bathroom modern. This is a well run hotel, parking is easy, although a charge is made, and the breakfast and dinner very good. Elche is an interesting city, and the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the centre.

Stayed here for 5 nights with my partner, a beautiful hotel with a lovely pool and night time setting, cute little rooms too, Ensure you scrub up on your english as a lot of the staff couldn't speak english, The room size was good, the bed was a little uncomfortable, I also found they didn't have a great choice of food if you are a fussy eater like me! and I have to say the cocktails were not great... Service was a little slow but all staff were friendly, Not in the best location either, the city centre is a little rough and not much choice for food and shops... but a nice little getaway.

Our booking was messed up , they blamed booking.com , the poolside service was diabolical , the waitresses were over worked , understaffed and moody , and when we left got charged more due to their principle booking mistake and they had no idea how to resolve the problem , just a joke , first time
I've ever felt the need to complain about anywhere on this app

This is not like a normal hotel, but bungalows in between the palm trees, you feel you are away from the town not in the middle of it. The bungalows are spacious and cleaned every day. The rooms are quiet. Whilst we were here for 5 days, there were 3 weddings, but we were not bothered by any noise. This is a beautiful place to stay, and the pool is surrounded by palm trees so you have shade if needed. The buffet breakfast is very good with all sorts of choice.
The staff are very friendly and helpful. The lunches and cocktails are great. We had one meal here and it was beautiful, compliments to the chef. We would recommend you eat here.
I would certainly stay here again, we had a great five days here, thank you to all the Staff.

titulo: Ideal stop away from the tourist trail.
conteudo: Set amongst the palm trees of the Palmeral it is a perfect setting away from the usual tourist haunts. Their prize possession is the swimming pool and poolside restaurant for dinner and breakfast. We had a problem in that the air con would not switch off but I'm sure that that was an isolated incident. Car parking good but cost 13€.

The best thing about the Hotel Huerto del Cura is that it does not look like a hotel. It is a collection of small bungalows spread around an oasis of palm trees and other plants. Located in front of the garden Huerto del Cura and close to Elche's city centre, you can not beat its location. Moreover the staff are nice and helpful!
The only drawback preventing me from giving it a 5 star rating is the quality of the rooms, which are a little bit basic for this price range

titulo: An oasis of good taste in elche (elx)
conteudo:
When we stay in Torrevieja we like to get away from the big crowds and the tuna fish salad to experience the spanish atmosphere. Elx is only a 40 min drive and has plenty of good restaurants, culture and great hotels to offer. One of this gems is the hotel del cura.

You can park your car for 10 euro at the doorstep and use your room key card to get in and out of the parking lot if needed. You can rent a buje for 10 euro a day or 2 euro for 1 hour.
An other extra is the 10 euro for breakfast which is fair: plenty of pastries, fruits, hams (all with an s so different kinds), cheeses (with an s), salmon, fruitjuices (s), cava, yoghurt, eggs(s), ... great value for your money and you can have bf outside. Which accentuates the holiday feeling.

The cocktails and drinks are reasonably prised and the bar closes round 1 (weekdays).

We took a smaller/ cheaper room so don t look at the pictures on their website if you don t take a more expensive cabin... they are smaller but you got everything you need. It s clean and comfortable and the airco works fine. Can somebody just change the lamps above the beds it ruins the romantic moments (i can get you a discount and give advice).

But the main character in this story is for the central part of the hotel. The swimming pool, the palm trees, the architecture which is quite exotic (how do you mean we re in a city center in spain) and combines a luxourious setting with great taste. At night with the bulbs and lamps it feels cosy and romantic.

The hotel is easy accesible and near the city center. It only takes a few minutes to get to local and some classy restaurants and pubs even michelin rewarded restaurants. So if you are a gourmet person you will love it. Romantic souls, people that appreciate the spanish way of living, palm tree lovers and globetrotters will enjoy the hotel and the city of elche (elx). For all others who aren t cinvinced yet: elche is the city of shoes.

We did not try the hotel restaurant but the menu looks good. The snacks and lunch are well presented.

Just one more thing if you go there: many people put their towel at 7 to get the best places at the swimming pool. They use their sunbed only round 3 so that makes me mad. Do that at benidorm but not here please.

So enjoy your stay at the hotel del cura and thank you for liking my resume.

My girlfriend and I visited the hotel for a couple of nights and we're blown away by the gardens and nature hidden within the establishment. The staff was very helpful and the bungalow style rooms make you feel at home and cozy as soon as you walk in. A nice sized bathroom and brilliant facilities accompany this oasis. We will definitely return.

titulo: Luxury Hotel but bad location in Elche Town
conteudo: Just returned from four days in Hotel Grupa Huerta del Cura - wonderful bungalow in the beautiful tropical style grounds, chill out terrace, pool area, fabulous food, friendly staff, tropical feel, great air con, especially as temperatures hit 42 degrees. Unfortunately the hotel is in an area of (Elche) town which is very rough, lots of grafitti, local thugs, we had an attempted mugging in the first 90 mins of arrival - 200 metres from hotel in a cafe/bar, then a further two drugged up characters approached us for money. Following day, police presence in same street (near hotel) after a mobile phone had been stolen and just a couple of hours later - same place, the contents of someone's luggage was dumped beside the dustbins on the roadside with their EU passport. Most of the hotels here are luxury but seem to be just stopping off places, en-route to airport or further afield.

We had never visited Elche and did not know what to expect of the city or the hotel but we have found a real gem! The grounds of the hotel are covered with palms and a variety of tropical plants that remind me of Hawaii or Southeast Asia. We stayed in a one bedroom bungalow which was decorated simply and very clean. I would say the only complaint we had was that the air conditioning didn't start to work until almost morning and our room was extremely hot. Of course we are American and love our air conditioning. Everything else exceeded our expectations!!!

We were here for five nights end of summer break. What a beautiful, tranquil hotel. The pool has a tropical like setting yet the hotel is minutes away from beautiful, bars,restaurants and shops.

The rooms are spotlessly clean with fresh towels and bed linen daily. Wifi is excellent and available throughout the hotel.

We will definitely return.

Beautiful, almost tropical location that remended us of Costa Rica with abundant vegetation and a a gorgeous large and cooling pool. All fully modernised is a very tasteful manner and excellent free WIFI everywhere. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Location could not be better as in the Palmera and opposite the beautiful garden Heurta Del Cura. Exceptionally good restaurant and the dinner poolside was a real traet for foodies like us.

Garden of eden ❤️❤️❤️❤️🌞

Very relaxing place, lovely atmosphere for getting away from stress and recharging.

The room is just perfect! Dinner is awesome could have wished for a better place to spend the first holiday with our 7 months baby❤️❤️❤️❤️

After getting married here we come back every year and it's is just as special as when we got married.

Rooms are spacious and we love how each one is slightly different

Pool area is v chilled out, you wouldn't think you were in a city with how the rooms and pool are set amongst the palm trees.

Great pool side bar, mojito are lovely .

We will be back again, u too the next time !

Nice hotel in the centre of Elche

Very laid back, with a nice deep swimming pool.Lots of palm trees in the grounds, give a deceptive feel of not being in town at all. You can imagine the beach just being on the authorised of all the palms. Gives it a nice tropical feel.

Nice food also

Absolutely a fantastic hotel!!!!!!!!!! I have now been here twice on business and this time I took both my sons with me and they was very happy, I would recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure, the staff are very good and helpful, fantastic shops and restaurants near by to be honest I will be going back next month

Just the respite we were looking for to get a break from the summer chaos at Playa De San Juan! The hotel was clean and the rooms are comfortable. Great pillows, cushy bed & air conditioning was perfect for 30+ heat!!! Pool is great with a smaller, shallow pool for the kids. Restaurant poolside for the evening offers a more gourmet menu is has a very romantic ambiance with lovely lights. Not too badly priced. Service is a bit slow, but it's ok ... We were there to relax & unwind! Most servers speak only broken English... So speak Spanish as much as possible. Reception area spoke English well. They also offer some spa services by appointment. Really enjoyed our stay here.

Took my 2 boys aways for 5 days. Totally relaxing experience in hotel, very chilled out around the pool area with good sunbeds and bar area. Staff friendly. Grounds and bungalow rooms feel spacious. Didnt rate the food from the ala carte menu but that may have been down to my choice as my sons enjoyed theirs. Good location in Elche and although not a great looking town there are some nice gardens and musuems to visit.

titulo: Bungalows in a palm-garden Fantastic romantic.
conteudo:
Very special rooms gives you a feeling from old times Clean and comfortable beds.
The restaurant presents the best of meat and fish from the area.
Very good service. The breakfast must be one of the best in Spain

titulo: An oasis of calm in the town centre
conteudo: Situated next to one of the palm groves,which Elche is famed for,so all rooms are amid these trees,within cabins,and allow guests to feel isolated from the hurly burly. And with a large swimming pool too,though their policy of 10am to 8pm discounts 2 of the best times to take a swim. That aside,the hotel is great,and close to the airport. Best of all, a snip at £60 per room per night.

The hotell is beautiful and it's garden is just wonderful. We had a bungalow which you share the building with 3 other guests. Be aware. The walls are thin. The reception is helpful and know English well which is uncommon in this parts. Although the other staff English is limited or non existing.

The rooms is average, I somehow expected more from a 4 star hotell. With that said the bed is rather comfortable. The WiFi is abnormal fast, the bathroom is in a need for a renovation, it has a 80 kinda feel to it. The chambermaid is excellent.

The pool area is wonderful. Lot of sun and swimming about near the garden is very peaceful. We came across something very annoying though. I was traveling with my pregnant wife and we hade a water bottle with us by the pool. The lifeguard I presume with his short and bright yellow shirt told us that outside water is prohibited in the pool area. Fine, I can accept that you can't bring your own soft drinks, alcohol or food but water which is essential for one well being?! I found that very absurd!

The restuarant? I wouldn't know because we never ate there. We did book one night to eat there outside by the pool. But the reception fail to tell us that the pool area were not available because of an and I quote unknown event

This might be a four star hotel, but it will only receive three star from me and my wife because of the service.

Hotel placed in a garden and just across there is the famous botanical garden. Room is very authentic but somewhat dark, but it is no problem. Breakfast saloon located just at the side of the pool. Very rich breakfast. Helpful desk and staff.

We came here as a quick getaway just for the night. The hotel has lovely peaceful vibes, and although right in the middle of the city, you feel a million miles away.
The food at the hotel itself was very good - and not over priced. (Not cheap either - just fair). And the location is amazing. The choice of fantastic eateries and bars within a 5 minute walk away is extensive.
This is a proper Spanish town - a welcome break from the heavy 'Englishness' of the Costa Blanca. Excellent service, very large, well designed rooms at a fair price. Perfect for a couples break.

We traveled here from Marbella on route to the uk and stayed for 1 night..
Everything trip advisor said was correct and the pictures were accurate..
We checked in at 11.15 pm and unfortunately the restaurant had just closed but the waitress did offer us some toast..
We checked in to our lovely little bungalow which was a superior room, clean and very Maldivian we thought.. The whole hotel is set on 1 level with bungalows dotted around in between beautiful green gardens and a spa with a zen area...
Wanting a few drinks acre our long drive we walked to the bar area passed the beautiful lit pool and candler dining area... The food smelt delicious although as I said we were too late to eat...
We sat on comfy rattan sofas and were served drinks until about 12.15 then the bar closed.. Have to say it was really relaxing listening to the chilled out music...
We had a good night sleep in the large comfortable beds...
Their was complimentary bottled water, average stocked mini bar, and good stick of soaps etc in the bathroom.. ( only 1 minor fault, hardly worth mentioning... Only a tiny bit of loo roll in the bathroom with no extra supply)
The breakfast was plentiful with all the usual good array of hot and cold foods you would expect...
We checked out the following morning with no problem back into our car which was parked in the hotel grounds with a safety barrier at a charge of 13 Euro for the overnight stay... It is only a small, about 25 cars.... But there is free parking outside on the RD...
All in all was a fabulous little find right in the middle of Elche...would highly recommend this hotel...

titulo: Tropical paradise, didn't want to go home!
conteudo:
Wow, this place is beautiful. The grounds are as lovely as the photos, immaculately kept, relaxing, you'd never know you were in the centre of town. The pool is gorgeous with lots of shady spots to relax in. The room was small but we'd only booked the basic one so can't complain about that. If I stayed again I'd consider upgrading. The room would benefit from more lights, it was very dark and there was no full length mirror, only the one above the sink in the bathroom. I would have liked a kettle, robe/slippers but guess they might come with the more expensive rooms. The whole hotel has an Asian vibe to it, so relaxing.
We ate in the restaurant once, the tables are set up by the pool which is a lovely setting. The main course was ok but the pudding was amazing. It's quite expensive compared to the other restaurants in town but worth it for the setting. Just right for a romantic dinner.
I would go back tomorrow if I could! Loved it!

titulo: very nice,quiet hotel in the palm threes
conteudo:
Very,very beautifull , in a palm tree garden. All rooms are a bungalows between flowers and trees. It is like you are in a hotel in Bali . Quiet , and still in the middle of the town. The restaurant is super !! Not expensive.
Must go to the hotel , the best of town !!

titulo: Wonderful hotel with small bungalows in a palmgarden in the centre of Elche
conteudo: This was my third visit to this hotel and again it was an amazing stay. The hotel is situated in the centre of Elche but the rooms are in bungalow style situated in a beautiful garden with palm trees. The swimming pool is big and there is a nice bar/lounge/restaurant area around the swimming pool. The hotel has a well known restaurant named Els Capellans. The food is very good, the service was during my dinner unfortunately a bit chaotic.

We had stayed here last year and were not too impressed. One of the managers Mr Alonso had said if we could come back again he would do all he could to make the experience better. The package he came up with included parking and breakfast and we got the superior room that we liked last year, and this time we had a perfect stay.
I spoke to Isobel Migueles Alonso's replacement and thanked her for the nice stay we are hoping to book again next year.
Breakfast is worth paying for, good quality and selection.
We avoided the Saturday night this time and would do this again as I think that's when the all night noisy party events happen

titulo: Wonderful resort in a cozy, Spanish town
conteudo: This place is more like a resort than a hotel. The ground are beautifully kept, with a handful of smaller, separate buildings with 3-4 rooms each. The pool is beautiful as well. The food on site is very good, and the breakfast buffet was among the best I have had in Europe. The best part is, the price is very, very reasonable for what you get. I will stay here every time I am in Alicante.

The hotel is very well placed near the central square but has fabulous gardens and a lovely pool. The rooms are in separate bungalows which are very well decorated and comfortable although the pillow was very small and if it were not late at night I would have asked for an extra one.
We ate in the restaurant and sat outside ,the meal was prety good although i had a veal steak and wasn't asked how I would like it so it came medium when i would have asked for rare. The wine was kept in an ice bucket so we had to ask for a top up and i would have preferred it was at the table . The waiter topped up my glass of water with wine!!
The sweet that I ordered came out as a chocolate brownie which is perhaps an acceptable mistake.What a shame that the Spanish love to ruin a meal by constantly smoking close by.

We booked two nights but left after one. There was a very foul smell from the bathroom. A case of bad plumbing. They offered us another room, but we didn't really bother moving rooms and risking the same smell. Staff was friendly though. But quite obvious they were aware of the problem. The location seemed nice with beautiful palmtrees.
I am sorry but I was disappointed. As mentioned wifi was very good.

titulo: A beautiful, relaxing place with comfortable rooms.
conteudo: The Hotel Huerto Del Cura is a well located hotel set among palm trees in a lovely garden. The World Heritage site garden of Horta del Cura is minutes away. It is pleasant roaming around the old town, particularly on a Sunday. It was an unexpected treat for myself and my family. I would recommend it as a place to relax and enjoy.

titulo: Hotel right in the middle of the Palmeral district
conteudo: Very nicely located hotel in the palms district. Small units distributed in the tropical garden make this a cool and cosy setting. Lots of green. We enjoyed a very good (conference) dinner. Nice breakfast buffet. If you don't know the city, the hotel is a little hard to reach because of all the small one-way streets, so a good description of the roads to take would be useful. Late check out is possible but costs you by the hour.

The place is very nice and relaxing. The units are like cottages surrounded by gardens. Our room is nice and clean. And the price is reasonable. The hotel is at the city center therefore everything is walking distance. I highly recommend this place.

A beautiful hotel , in what felt like you were out in the country, but in fact you are very central. Wake to the sounds of birds! Exceptionally well maintained. Great efficient staff! I'm almost reluctant to share what I thought as I'd like to keep it to myself , but I can't resist ! If you are flying into Alicante or Valencia , go go go !!!!

titulo: A great hotel in a fantastic location
conteudo:
This is a hotel with a difference. It is only 5 minutes from the centre of Elche but all the rooms are in bungalows set in tropical grounds of palm trees and other lush vegetation. With four rooms to a bungalow and plenty of space between them it is very quiet and rather exotic.

There is a great pool and pool side area although that wasn't open in March. Breakfast is in a room over looking the pool and the spread is pretty impressive with a good range of hot and cold dishes. They do need to get a new toaster though! It is self service and I get the feeling that especially in the winter season it is a working hotel as when we went to breakfast early at 7:30 because we had to get on the road the room was packed. At 8:30 it is empty and a much more pleasant environment. Still plenty to eat as the buffet is replenished regularly .
The bar area in the main building is pretty dark but again service is OK when you discover the bell to ring. A little annoying that the bar snacks outside dining hours are restricted to crisps or olives. The bar menu only being available when the kitchen is staffed - very annoying as we wanted to have an early snack one evening and couldn't.
Front desk staff as very helpful and there is a large underground car park that must be very useful in the summer when it is hot. You have to pay for parking whether you use the above or underground car park but it is worth getting the car off the road that is very busy. We didn't have sat nav but knew how to find the hotel. It is well signed posted but a lot of the roads in the centre of Elche are one way so if you miss it going round again can be quite difficult and frustrating.

As you may know I use a wheelchair and they have a good accessible room; room 226. This has ramp to the front door, other rooms have a step, and then I think the inside layout is pretty similar to a normal room but with a sliding door to the bathroom and a walk in shower. More hand rails and a fold down seat in the shower would make it A1. There is plenty of room to manoeuvre a w/c in the bedroom and bathroom areas and it is a really well designed layout. Lots of lights every where, never found out what some of the switches controlled. Good TV but some of the digital channels tended to break up and excellent free WiFi.

A really lovely hotel and grounds and we will be returning again in the future.

titulo: Great hotel, great staff,  great location
conteudo:
The hotel is easy to find with sat nav and located in what appears to be a tropical garden yet within a 5 min walk of the city restaurants, shops and bars. All accommodation is in bungalows giving a Far East feel to the place and the rooms within the bungalows are spacious and well kept.
The two ladies on reception on our arrival were professional and friendly and very informative about where our bungalow was located and info on the underground parking. The parking is public parking but secure and access is good.
Breakfast was a little disappointing as although there was a good buffet selection the hot choice (British breakfast) was limited in choice (no baked beans or grilled tomatoes option). Also there are no tea or coffee facilities in your room/bungalow.
All in all a very pleasant overnight stay but next time we'll take a travel kettle and coffee and tea.
I would highly recommend this hotel and will return in the warmer months to stay and use the outdoor pool which looked so inviting but the water was cold

Beautiful hotel located in a garden of palm trees and banana trees. All rooms are placed in sort of bungalows within this garden.

Interior decoration in the rooms and throughout the entire hotel and premises are really beautiful, simple but with the use of furniture that gives you a taste an impression of something slightly tropical.

Service at reception is really kind and attentive. Everything is functional.

I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Nice rooms in well kept grounds surrounded by palm trees
Well located for local restaurants and shops
Breakfast is fantastic when included in the price :) quality is great
Think it's 12 euros without
Lovely to sit by the pool with a drink in the summer

This is a lovely hotel set in beautiful tropical gardens, the reception and cleaning staff are very helpful and friendly. I booked the Romantic package for 2 nights this included a Mini Suite which was superb, evening meal in the restaurant with cava and chocolates. Unfortunately we were not allowed to chose from the restaurant menu but were told that we had to have menu of the day which on 1 night the meat was described as muscle this was extremely tough and grisly which spoilt our evening. No mention of this meal arrangement is shown when booking and at the price paid it should be a choice from the full restaurant menu.

Stayed here for 3 nights for a break in Feb. Had a junior suite which was very comfortable, with a separate room with sofa, TV and wardrobe. Nicely decorated with a comfortable bed, located in the well kept grounds, which reminded us more of Asia than Spain.
The heating has thoughtfully been turned on as it did get very chilly at night!
The breakfast was very good, huge selection, catering to every taste.
Receptionists were very helpful and recommended places to see and eat throughout Elche.
Unfortunately they did have a conference at the hotel at the same time, which although only impacted a little, we felt that they should have warned us when we booked several months before.

My husband and I stayed for one night, after a late flight. The receptionist was very welcoming, went through all the information with us and we went to find our room. And what a nice surprise it was! Lots of space, great bathroom and the biggest bed I've ever slept in! We went for a drink and some tapas in the bar as it was late, all very relaxed. Breakfast the next morning was good too and it was a thoroughly lovely start to our Spanish break. Would definitely return in the future.

We stayed there for three nights in August. Absolutely marvellous! You rather think you are at some Thai resort: the decoration at the reception area has a certain oriental inspiration, then the rooms are scattered in small bungalows in their own palmyard with lush vegetation. The pool área is nice, there are always enough sunbeds around and it doesn't get that crowdy. The rooms are a bit simple, but then again this is not a place you go for business but definitely one to spend a few relaxing holidays. Service is excellent. We experienced a minor problem which was solved immediately. The pool area is also where you can have your dinner, in a romantic candle light setting. Or just a late evening cocktail. The hotel is located within walking distance of everything in Elche, and you can park your car either on the hotel grounds (paying) or about 100metres away on a free parking lot.
It is the ideal place to relax a few days.

Low season offer of the hotel was irresistible (70 euros or so) and it was totally worth it. Their own palmeral gives the bungalows something special and at night time it's nice to walk around. Location is excellent to spot the city by walking. Quiet place and very good sleep, and good shower.

I booked this hotel because I had visited it previously for coffee during a visit to the famous Huerto del Cura Garden, which is located just across the road. When I was looking for a hotel where we could celebrate my husband's birthday, I thought this would be ideal. We booked 2 nights of the Romantic Deal which included various treats plus breakfast and dinner, and we chose to have a superior room. This is a classy hotel, a haven of tranquility and peace, run by excellent staff in all areas. All the rooms are in the gardens and so well placed and constructed that they are hardly noticeable when walking through the gardens. Take an umbrella if you think it might rain. A bar and restaurant with luxurious chairs and space between tables - bliss. No noisy entertainment to endure. No noise of guests trundling suitcases along corridors in the early hours, or shouting out after being in the local night clubs for hours. We had a wonderful stay and will go there again.

titulo: A tropical paradise in the middle of the town of Elche.
conteudo:
We stayed 3 nights. It was a lovely hotel with lovely people.
The weather was great, not sure how it would have been had it been raining, a bit dark, I think?
Rooms were lovely, we chose a junior suite. But no outside area to sit and have a drink with the room.
We had half board, the dinner was excellent and good value.
Breakfast was great on the cold selection, but the hot food was cold and un inspiring.
Having the town and it's history and culture within walking distance was a great bonus.
On the whole I would recommend this charming hotel.
We had a lovely in break in a great hotel for a reasonable price!
The WIFI was excellent!!

What a great hotel. Set in gardens that are like a paradise with so many palm trees and beautiful greenery. The rooms were good with some nice touches here and there. The bar area was well utilised. ;-) The location is great. Only a couple of minutes walk from the centre of Elche with its bars and some really good restaurants. Excellent.

titulo: Reminds of hotels resorts in thailand or indonesia
conteudo:
Beautifully located in El Palmeral, very quite location.
The standard room is clean and large, all in the colonial style
One previous reviewer is mentioning some shabby fittings, could not confirm this
The breakfast could be improved in respect to bread choices.
(-) The personal is too slow, took 30 min for check out as the receptionist needed to explain to the Swedish tourists in all detail where the next McDonalds on the way to the shoe bazaar is and people were waiting and waiting....
Should try the nice restaurant across the road in front of the entrance to the El Palmeral to the left side of the hotel - behind the glass windows direct on the street (sorry, do not remember the name, but the food is excellent)

Visited for a night while on holiday,the wife wanted to visit and I'm glad I listened,cracking hotel with great rooms that are like little villas dotted around the pool,great outside bar and a lovely breakfast,a short walk to the shops and restaurants.

Second time here as a 4 star its ok great setting pool good although not enough sun beds , we had a junior suite not much difference to a normal room an additional tv and sofa in seperate room . room in need of a paint you could see what looked like a picture had been taken down on the walls .Also rooms very sparse no pictures or rugs quite cold looking but clean and bed comforable,air con good .Food ok trying a bit to hard sauces on meat a bit sweet .Breakfast dissapointing Hot choices dried up eggs bad and bacon not cooked.Shame has potential to be better.

Stayed one week as part of a business trip + Week End. The hotel is located inside a palm grove, and composed of bungalows with a central building only for reception and the main indoor restaurant. It is still within walking distance of the city centre, congress centre, and main attractions. We were upgraded to a junior suite, which has a small separate lounge with additional TV, sofa and working desk/table. The room was relatively spacious, with good, modern, aircon devices (one for each room). Furniture, however, was a bit on the rustic side. Comfortable bathroom, despite occasional sewage smells during the stay.
This is more a place to live outdoor, with plenty of space by the swimming pool, including a poolside bar serving light bites, and tables from the main restaurant in the evening. Good wifi throughout, including by the pool. The hotel is excellent value in June, if booked early, and that extends to various hotel services (restaurant, bar ...).
Efficient and friendly service throughout, including free late check-out.

room set in bungalow and spacious . Bathroom also very spacious . Good air conditioning comfy bed .set in Palm lined paved paths .good pool and food could not fault . All staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly.
Good value breakfast .wifi worked very well and easy connection.
Underground parking a bonus when the temperature is in the high 30 s
Spent two pleasant nights here

We spent one night here, a Monday, so no weddings or parties. Yes, it's an excellent location near the city centre and yes it's in a beautiful setting with a lovely pool. Totally spoilt by the accommodation. We had booked a Superior Room, dread to think what a Standard is like. We queried as to whether we had been given the correct room grade with Reception, she pretended she didn't understand what I meant despite her speaking English and me repeating in Spanish. The bungalow had 2 plus points: quiet, efficient air conditioning and a comfortable bed. The furniture was sparse and basic, the TV was in a shabby chic cupboard set across the corner, the rattan chairs were uncomfortable so to view you had to sit on the bed and look sideways! The safe was in the wardrobe, it's door with instructions for use opened towards the back of the wardrobe which meant craning to read them and using a torch. The bathroom was dark, only a shower over the bath, no grab rails, no non-slip surface, bath towels on hook in toilet cubicle, hand towels folded on vanity unit with no space to hang once used. No shaving mirror, the waste bin was a wicker basket totally unsuitable for sanitary items (no bags either). Not a picture on the walls, no rugs, no bedside cabinets, in fact nowhere to put anything. A longer stay would be very uncomfortable. Rustic shabby chic meets spartan, totally unacceptable for the price we paid.
The restaurant food was good but the service, though friendly was amateurish, breakfast acceptable. What a shame, this hotel trades on it's location. Don't think there's another 4 star in Elche so it has no competition.

We spent 5 nights during here and had a restful, peaceful stay. On arrival we were greeted by friendly staff and told they had upgraded our room at no extra cost. The room was very spacious, very clean and a comfortable bed. The pool area was fantastic and not too busy (no rushing for sun beds!) The hotel is surrounded by beautiful gardens and Palm trees, such a calm, quiet retreat. We went for a relaxing break and that is exactly what we got! The shops and restaurants are within walking distance and you can eat out quite cheaply. Overall we had a lovely time and would highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel offers excellent value for money. Service throughout was friendly and efficient. We stayed for a week in June, very hot so we spent time using the pool. It's a wonderful space surrounded by palm trees, clean and has plenty of shade and sunny spots too. There is a bar and chill out area which we availed ourselves of frequently! We ate lunch twice, which was very nice and casual offering typical Spanish food or a burger/pizza if you must. In the evening it's turned into a more formal space as a restaurant which we used once, the food was very nice and not too expensive either. The room was one of the 'bungalows' we had a 'suite' as there for a week, it was a good size and clean, with working air con. As others have said it's simply furnished which we were fine with, the bathroom could do with a refurbish but it was OK. There was a wedding there on the Saturday night, we went out for the evening and it didn't bother us one bit, in fact it was lovely to see the bride and guests dressed so beautifully. There is a cockerel crowing, but we had the windows shut at night so didn't impact on us and we slept well in the large comfortable bed.
We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, only because we're not big breakfast eaters. Just out of the hotel turn left there are a couple of cafes serving toasted baguette and coffee at very cheap prices.
The hotel is in easy walking distance of all the beautiful plazas and little shops and restaurants. We had a car (parking was extra - they should offer a discount if you're there for a week), the beaches of Santa Pola and Arenales del Sol (our favourite) are an easy 20 min drive (take a Sat Nav!).
We will definitely return to this gorgeous hotel.

We spent the one night here to coincide with a wedding reception we attended the same day. From the moment we entered the hotel entrance everyone was exceptionally friendly and efficient - car park barrier man, receptionist, waiters, restaurant manager etc. The hotel and grounds are wonderful. The whole feel of the place is that you are on some idyllic tropical island and not in the middle of a busy town. Our room was in a bungalow in the grounds and was perfectly acceptable, if a little small. The bathroom and wet-room were of a very good quality and the furniture simple. The cost of the room was a little above what I would consider it to be worth and then car parking was an additional 13 euros per day. This did not spoil the day or the stay though.

Booked a 10 night stay in a 'Superior' room, emailed 3 weeks before to request a quiet room. On arrival on the Monday we were given room 225. Room was dark, old, dilapidated, broken shutters letting in noise and light. Sink not level so wife's cosmetics soaked with water. All through daylight hours load cock crowing next door. Woken every morning at 4am to water gushing. Third night we discovered we were right behind the breakfast/pool area. Live band kept us from going to sleep. At 11pm I spoke to reception, they offered another room further away from the noise #252. However this room did not have working air conditioning. Broken unit on door. Told we could only stay there one night anyway! Went back to original room, thankfully by midnight noise had stopped.
It transpired that the gushing water at 4am was from a hosepipe connected to a standpipe aimed at the side of the room, this was why the window was rotting away.
Lady from reception said this could not be switched off, gave us a better room which we had to wait to Friday before we could move. Assured us that this room was in the centre of the hotel grounds. We would get little noise from all the weekend reception parties, reunions, college graduations. Over the weekend this place is a conveyor belt of discos, parties all generating massive noise to hotel guests.
The lady was wrong about it being a quieter room.
Friday night hordes of youths shouting, screaming running around the grounds past midnight.
Saturday night several weddings, noise from INVERNADERO events area disco going on until almost 5AM.
Phoned reception around 2AM, told it would finish around 3AM didn't!
Sunday we felt like zombies, a completely ruined holiday.
To cap it all we wanted a quiet time on the Sunday afternoon in the pool area. Then swarms of baptism parties arrived with screaming kids took over the whole area.
If you want a hotel that is peaceful advise you to stay elsewhere, they are only interested in making money from events, and not hotel guest satisfaction.
I suspect the good reviews saying it's quiet are from short stay mid week travellers who do not have to suffer these noisy events.

Only a one night stay here, but a different set up with regards to the rooms, the rooms were in blocks of 4 with each block being a separate chalet style building.

Had the opportunity to enjoy a coffee around the pool, which was pleasant surrounded by palm trees.

Breakfast and the evening meal were both good with plenty of choice and good quality.

titulo: Great setting and first class restaurant
conteudo:
My family (2 toddlers) and I had a great time here. The staff were friendly and accommodating. They had posted the rooms were only for 3, but they made the bed of a love seat for our 3 yo. There are playgrounds and parks within 100 m. The restaurant food was amazing, fresh truffles, monkfish, veal and the greatest foie-gras and date combination.

One thing that struck us as odd though, was we thought we would have a queen and a single bed, but the queen ended up being just two singles pushed together.

Spent a few days in Elche seeing friends. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel.
It was very quiet even with the addition of the Vallencia football team who were playing locally.
I'd love to go back when the weather was better but I suspect we wouldn't be getting the same room rate!
Very close to the city centre but feels like you are secluded.
Nothing bad to say about this hotel or its attentative friendly staff.

Back today from 4 nights at the hotel.Beautiful bungalow in peaceful grounds...yet right in city centre!
25 euros by taxi from Alicante airport.
Visits to Santa Pola and Alicante city.
Hotel staff excellent.Big thanks.
Would definitely like to return.

titulo: When in Elche, there is nowhere else but here.
conteudo:
I stayed 2 nights here, what a great resort style accommodation right in the heart of Elche. Peaceful and tranquil settings, you would think you were the only guest. The layout of the bungalows amongst the native palms is surreal. Each room was large and comfortable with all you need. I had the Bed and Breakfast option and the breakfast was plentiful with a good choice. You can get a better location to walk into any part of Elche for a multitude of restaurants. I was here for cycling and the way in and out of the city was a breeze. All the staff were more than helpful and with my lack of Spanish, english wasnt a problem.
I'll be staying here again.

titulo: Tranquil place near the centre of Elche
conteudo: Stayed here 2 nights and would definitely recommend. The place has an air of calmness and tranquility despite being very close to the centre of Elche. The rooms are small chalet type buildings which reminded me of an Eco type sanctuary hotel in a tropical setting. Lovely garden and pool although it was not hot enough to sit out. Would love to return in the summer. Elche is a delightful city with excellent shops and lots of places to eat.

titulo: Beautiful hotel, wonderful service, amazing food
conteudo:
I have no complains about this hotel. Stayed here for a business trip for 3 days at the end of November, 2014. Was greeted by a very welcoming staff, which addressed all my questions and provided suggestions for places to visit and shop around.
My room was not very big and had a simple decoration, but it was clean, comfortable and had everything i needed. It is totally worth having breakfast at this hotel- there is a wide variety of options from juices, fruits, cheeses, vegetables, jams, breads, etc. I also had dinner at the hotel restaurant on one occasion (the braised octopus), and it was wonderful.
All the staff around the hotel are very friendly, and greet you and smile at all times. During my visit, i needed to store some things that did not fit in my refrigerator, and the staff offered their larger refrigerators so i could store them until my time to leave to the airport.
Overall, i had a wonderful experience in this hotel, would definitely recommend it and look forward to visiting again.

Set in the middle of Elche, stepping into this hotel from the town's bustle is like stepping into a luxury hotel in the Caribbean, Maldives or Indonesia. Palms everywhere, a large sweeping pool and walkways through the trees to your bungalow bedroom. Staff excellent and the food in the restaurant is not to be missed. A real Masterclass in good cuisine. So why not five stars?
Bedrooms. These are low rent. Bare walls and floors with an entrance corridor that has no light fitting which means wardrobe and safe are in darkness. It's all a bit tired and grubby with tatty doors and no where to hang a hand towel other than putting it down by the side of the wet basin. It doesn't meet Premier Inn or Travel Lodge standards.
But....
If you ignore this (and you don't live in the bedroom and beds are comfortable), the hotel offers an experience. You might want to avoid Saturdays as this location is a honey pot for local weddings. The huerta across the road is not to be missed. Would return just for the food and look to see if there were better bedrooms for an upgrade.

titulo: everything Nice, and worth the visit
conteudo:
We had a good one night stay in this quatro bungalow type stile of lodging, good beds, big rooms, al you need. and it was clean. Its also in a good location for exploring the cosy town of elche. (make sure to take the palm garden across the street)
Friendly staff as well.
The breakfast was also suprisingly good ! I did not try the pool or the hotel restaurant.

Situado en pleno centro de Elche, muy cerca de la Basílica y del casco antiguo de la ciudad. El hotel tiene parking, pero no está dentro del hotel, está en la calle de al lado. En la zona del Parque Municipal y de la estación del tren, junto al Colegio Candalix hay un parking gratuito, bastante grande. La habitación con vistas a la calle de entrada al hotel, es bastante cómoda, con dos camitas en las que dormimos muy bien, el baño con ducha; aunque echamos en falta artículos de aseo. No comimos allí, pero si vimos que tenía un menú del día por 12 €. El personal muy amable. En definitiva un buen hotel, y con una situación magnifica.

Hemos estado cuatro noches en este hotel durante nuestra visita a Elche. A destacar, entre otras cosas, su ubicación en pleno centro de la ciudad, aunque ello conlleve algunos problemas de aparcamiento; el garaje del hotel con pocas plazas y el que tienen concertado un poco lejano y sin sitio para parar en la puerta a la hora de dejar o recoger equipaje, aunque de esto la culpa la tiene el ayuntamiento. Otra cosa a destacar es la amabilidad de todo el personal, recepción, restaurante, camareras de piso. La habitación bien en general, aunque un poco pequeña al igual que le baño. Daba a un patio interior, así que el ruido por esa parte era inexistente. El desayuno fantástico, con un buffet muy bien asistido por el personal y con muchas posibilidades. En definitiva, hotel muy recomendable para visitar Elche.

Hotel con una relación calidad precio excelente, fantástica situación, habitaciones prácticas y muy bien equipadas, televisión muy pequeña. Desayuno buffet muy correcto poca variedad pero una calidad buena. Parking espacioso pero fuera del hotel sin conexión directa se debe ir por la calle.

Hotel bien situado, con habitaciones bien dotadas y personal muy atento
El precio es adecuado a lo que ofrece
Por poner una pega el desayuno es un poco especial, ofrecen la posibilidad de desayunar a la carta

El hotel no tiene ni parking ni piscina, las habitaciones se quedan bastante obsoletas, muy diferente comparado al Tryp de Valencia. Para el mismo precio dos hoteles muy diferentes.
Eso si, el equipo de Recepcion muy amable y serviable.

titulo: Céntrico y muy buena relación calidad precio
conteudo:
Hotel céntrico, buena atención, personal agradable.
Habitación muy amplia, colchón cómodo y en nuestro caso un baño grande con mucha presión en la ducha.
Sin duda totalmente recomendable, una grata sorpresa.

Una experiencia genial. Hotel muy céntrico. Habitaciones muy limpias y confortables, el restaurante Aladia es un diez tanto por la calidad y variedad de la comida como por el servicio que fue muy amable y atento en todo momento, especialmente Finabel y Patricia. 100% recomendable

Hotel tranquilo, para descansar tras un duro día de trabajo. Cocina y personal en el restaurante excelente. Atención al cliente muy buena. Buena ubicación en el centro de Elche. Relación calidad-precio excelente.

Repetiría sin dudarlo. Excelente ubicación en el centro, habitación limpia y tranquila, pequeña pero suficiente para descansar y dejar las maletas. El trato del personal también excelente, siempre tratando de ayudar. El único pero es que la habitación, al ser pequeña, apenas tenía espacio para abrir las maletas. Por lo demás todo muy bien.

todo estuvo muy bien a destacar el personal de recepcion y restaurante y sobretodo a la persona de recepcion lcreo que se llamaba manu porque tuvimos un problema en relacion al coche y la informacion que nos dio pudimos soluccionar el problema

titulo: Un hotel muy bien situado, cómodo y funcional.
conteudo: Nos ha gustado mucho el hotel. Accedimos al upgrade ya que pertenecemos al club Meliá Rewards. Nos ofrecieron una habitación superior y nos sentimos muy cómodos. El baño muy espacioso y funcional, con ducha italiana, un gran espejo, los puntos de luz más que suficientes y bien ubicados, y toallas grandes y de calidad. Buen servicio de habitaciones y simpatía y profesionalidad a la hora de recibir a los clientes. Destacamos especialmente a la señorita Mamen en el check-out, por su simpatía, empatía y eficiencia. Una experiencia muy agradable que repetiremos, sin duda. Nos encantó la ciudad y volveremos a alojarnos en el Tryp Ciudad de Elche!!

Nos gustó mucho la habitación, el baño y el trato de la recepcionista. También la ubicación, muy céntrico pero muy tranquilo. Volveríamos a este hotel sin duda alguna, por su muy buena relación calidad/precio.

Muy bien situado en el centro de Elche, a un paso del centro histórico y ofertas de ocio. Se aconseja reservar plaza de garaje, buena relación calidad- precio, servicio muy atento, habitaciones pequeñas, bien insonorizadas.

Alojamiento cómodo, céntrico y buena calidad en el servicio de restauracion
Cerca de la estación y del centro de las calles peatonales
Muy buena relación precio-calidadLa única pega los platos ducha por su escasa eficacia Ani slip

Muy céntrico y tranquilo. Los trabajadores excelentes. Las Habitaciones limpias y cómodas, la tele nos pareció un poco pequeña, pero en general es un hotel muy completo, la cena muy buena.
Recomendable al 100 %.

Los cuartos de baños bastante pequeños, muy reducido el espacio. El resto de las instalaciones, habitaciones, insonorización y temperatura eran satisfactorias en mi opinión. Eché de menos espacios comunes en el bar u otros.

Mención especial para Angela de recepción. La camarera del restaurante Finabel y la cocinera.
El servicio del restaurante fue estupendo tanto en calidad como en cantidad. Y el trato recibido excelente también en todos los sentidos.

Nada que objetar.
La habitación y baño perfecto.
Muy buen desayuno y cena.
El trato del personal excelente.
Al no disponer del parking del hotel,(estaba en obras) me ofrecieron un parking un parking gratuito. Las medidas de Covid excelentes.

El hotel está muy bien situado, en el centro de Elche. Tiene parking de pago previa reserva, por si no quieres marearte encontrando aparcamiento, ya que es un poco complicado aparcar en esa zona.
Habitaciones sencillas con todas las comodidades.

titulo: Acogedor, la gente superamable, tanto en recepción como en el restaurante... Volveré!
conteudo:
Personal superamable, y una recepción y restaurante superacogedora.
Me sentí mejor que en casa, detalles de bienvenida que me encantaron...
A mejorar el tema de que han hecho la calle semipeatonal, y produce algún problema para solicitar taxi (solucion: cruzar la acera) ;)

Nos alojamos una noche por nuestro paso por la ciudad de Alicante. Pagamos por la estancia un total de 69 €. Cuenta con parking privado en las inmediaciones ¡Ojo! es necesario antes realizar la reserva, tiene un coste de 12 € por día. No te preocupes si no disponen de plazas, ellos tienen un convenio con el Parking Saba, ofreciendo el mismo precio, eso sí esta a unos metros del hotel.

Muy buena relación calidad precio. Muy bien situado. Trato excelente. La cama muy cómoda, pero la TV un poco pequeña.
Deberían incluir algunas botellas de agua pequeña en la nevera. Fue lo único que eche en falta, poder beber agua mineral.

Estuve 3 semanas por trabajo en este hotel, la atención siempre fue correcta.

La cama cómoda , y en el restaurante se cenaba muy bien

Como puntos negativos la limpieza de habitaciones es muy ruidosa y el aire acondicionado hacía ruido aún apagado

titulo: Hotel urbano con personal muy amable
conteudo: Un hotel de ciudad , sencillo pero muy funcional . Está muy bien ubicado para poder moverte caminando por todo el centro .El personal , atento y amable . Muy pulcro y cuidadoso con las medidas higiénicas debidas al covid19 . Buen desayuno , aunque ahora , por motivos sanitarios , no está a la vista . Me sirvieron en la mesa y había mucha variedad para elegir . Por poner un pero , el aire acondicionado tenía muy poca potencia y eso con el calor de este agosto...

Situado en el centro de Elche, es un buen lugar para llegar andando a cualquier punto de la ciudad. Las recepcionistas agradables. Me gustaría comentar que aunque no tengo certeza total pero al día siguiente tenía las piernas llenas de picotazos creo que ocasionados por chinches de la cama. Solventado este desagradable inconveniente es un buen hotel.

Hotel cómodo, excelente ubicación.
Una atención extremadamente cordial, correcta y el personal siempre con muy buena predisposición.
La televisión muy pequeña.
El aire acondicionado un poco flojo.
En general, muy recomendable

titulo: Buen hotel pero los ruidos de la calle terribles
conteudo: Estuve una sola noche, la habitación preciosa, muy limpia con un salón y terraza. El parking muy bien también. Pero tuve la mala suerte que a las 3 de la mañana me desperté y ya no me pude dormir porque a la gente le ha dado por hacer botelleo en la calle del hotel que tiene una tienda de comestibles cerca. Sí voy otra vez pediré una habitación interior que supongo que no tendrá ruidos.

titulo: En el centro de la ciudad
conteudo:
Nos quedamos una noche mi pareja y yo para conocer Elche. Teníamos el desayuno y a cena. El desayuno es pequeñito pero tiene de todo (dulce y salado), y para la cena te dan a elegir dos primeros, dos segundos y dos postres, estaba todo riquísimo y buena cantidad. Muy bien situado, en el centro. La chica de recepción muy amable cuando hicimos el check in nos explicó las principales atracciones turísticas para visitar, los horarios de las comidas... Nosotros aparcamos en un parking público cerca del hotel, a unos 5 minutos andando, ya que por la zona no hay aparcamiento.
El único pero por decir algo fue el mal olor del baño, olor a tuberías... algo difícil de solucionar.
Repetiré!

titulo: Por debajo de la media de la zona al mismo precio
conteudo:
