Como miembro platino de IHG, estaba un poco decepcionado con el servicio de atención al cliente en este hotel.

El hotel está en un parque industrial y se ve muy bien desde el exterior.

Creo que llegué al hotel sobre las 11:30 h y la recepcionista me registró mientras que tener una conversación con otra señora española y su copa de vino.

No nos recibieron como miembro de platino y no ofrecía ninguna ventaja normalmente asociado con ello.

La habitación era adecuada, aunque el plato de ducha en mi habitación tenía dos grietas grandes al otro lado, no es seguro que esto fue realmente un hotel de 4 estrellas.

El desayuno era correcto, no estoy seguro de los huevos revueltos, que parecía ser una coagulación de huevo con vestigios quemadas.

La hora de salida fue una experiencia mucho más agradable, y no que no era porque estaba dejando ... el recepcionista era mucho más profesional.

El precio era muy razonable, pero era molesta con la hora de llegada.

titulo: Bueno, un hotel limpio y moderno.
conteudo: Nos alojamos aquí como una parada antes de volar de Alicante. Sí, el hotel está en el medio de un polígono industrial (ya que es dirección Unidos), pero es muy moderno, muy limpio y muy eficiente. Si quiere salir por la noche, sin embargo puede que quieras eligió en otro sitio. Para nosotros, fue perfecta. Era tranquilo, con un agradable bar/recepción que tenía buena, WiFi gratuito. El personal con el que nos encontramos fue muy agradable y eficiente. No comimos una comida por la noche pero tuvimos excelente Gin Tonic y vino en un cómodo asiento en la zona de bar. La habitación estaba limpia, el baño muy moderno, con una gran ducha, y la cama era cómoda. El desayuno estaba muy bien presentado y era de estilo bufé. Reservamos un taxi al aeropuerto la mañana siguiente, que llegó a 5 minutos y el pasaje hasta el aeropuerto es de 17 euros (su negocio podría beneficiar de un servicio de transporte). Una buena experiencia - lo volveré a hacer.

Muy agradable y servicio de primera clase y el personal hablaba bien inglés.La comida en el restaurante era excelente, de hecho, tan buenos que comimos en cada noche que estuvimos allí, y era muy razonable a sólo 12 euros por una cena de 3 platos incluyendo una bebida
La habitación era tan fresca y limpia, todo cambió cada día, el personal era muy servicial y nos cuidó como si fuéramos de la familia.
Ya que el hotel está en una zona industrial muy moderno, con muchas tiendas de outlet y en las afueras de la ciudad, es mejor alquilar un coche.

El hotel está situado justo al lado de la famosa zona industrial de elche. parecía muy moderno no como algunos viejas vacaciones que está por allí, ya que la abuela era un adolescente. Sirven muy buena gin tonic y hay un muy buen ambiente de bar

Nos alojamos allí por una noche después de nuestra llegada a España. Elegir este hotel porque estaba cerca del aeropuerto. Está situado en el medio de una zona industrial - por la tarde, es completamente vacío y tranquilo.

Habitación estaba limpia, pero era muy pequeña. La cama doble resultó ser simplemente dos camas juntas - no es bueno para parejas acostumbrados a acurrucarnos juntos cuando dormir. Baño limpio, con buena presión de agua en la ducha.

Free WiFi funciona correctamente en el vestíbulo, mientras que la cobertura se extiende a las habitaciones no funciona allí. Parece otros tuvieron el mismo problema, ya que se podía ver gente con ordenadores portátiles que ocupa el vestíbulo por la noche.

Cenamos tarde en el restaurante del hotel. Queríamos pedir un plato de arroz, pero la camarera nos avisó de que puede ser demasiado pesado en la noche y nos recomendó el menú del día. Consistía en una ensalada, un plato sencillo pero sabroso de pollo a la plancha con arroz y cremosa salsa y un flan es - todo de postre de que estaba bastante bien.

Selección de desayuno limitado, pero de buena calidad con dos excepciones: huevos revueltos claramente de una mezcla de fábrica, incomible - y un café que era positivamente le parezca repulsivo. En realidad, esa - o de café para ser preciso falta de apetecible café por la mañana - era lo que costaba este hotel un punto en mi crítica.

Nos pusieron en este hotel después de nuestros vuelos fue cancelado.
El hotel está en el medio de un parque industrial con nada cerca a una corta distancia a pie.
El hotel estaba muy limpio y con un buen estándar.
El personal del hotel hablaba muy bien inglés.
La habitación estaba limpia y se repone todos los días.
La comida estaba bien, nada para morirse.
Los precios del bar a través de la azotea.

titulo: Un buen hotel para una parada del aeropuerto
conteudo: Un hotel limpio para una parada después de volar a y antes de volar desde el aeropuerto de Alicante. No es fácil de encontrar pero muy bueno una vez localizado. Es un buen restaurante y aparcamiento hacen de este hotel un ganador. Sin duda lo recomiendo

titulo: Un buen hotel para una noche
conteudo: Un buen hotel para una noche cuando viajas. Situado en una businesspark cerca del aeropuerto de Alicante. Habitaciones para no fumadores, a pesar de un ligero olor a tabaco. El servicio es bueno. El desayuno no estaba mal. El personal es muy amable y con espíritu de servicio. Parking: No hay problema.

Reservé este hotel por una noche antes de ir a Benidorm para el resto de nuestras vacaciones. Lo reservé porque era un hotel de aeropuerto y dijo que tenía un autobús de enlace del aeropuerto en línea -no! Teníamos que ir unos minutos taxi,5 lejos pero €20 tarifa ... cada viaje. Está en el medio de un parque industrial, así que no hay paradas de autobús cerca. Y nada más.cenamos después de llegar, fue horrible. Y el desayuno no era mejor. Muy poco personal y no grandes hablen inglés.
Lo que pensé que estaba ahorrando por estar aquí, acabé pasando de los taxis y comida. Deberían haber reservado un traslado de Benidorm para la noche de llegada y nos alojamos en el hotel encantador.
No volveré y no lo recomiendo!

nuevo mientras trabajaba en la zona sin lugar fijo para alojarse, busca hoteles en TripAdvisor / google para encontrar cadenas familiares donde sé que pueden aparecer y todo funcionará. No siempre, pero esta seguramente no. predominantemente que quería algo más o menos cerca del aeropuerto ya que sería mi próxima parada y cuando llegué me quedé asombrado por el tranquilo estilo atrio grande. Habitación estaba muy limpia, todo funcionaba, el servicio era bueno en el bar y el restaurante incluso protegen bien con unos 100 niños que se alojaban allí en una especie de gira deportiva! Sin duda me alojaría aquí de nuevo al transitar por ALC. Habitación era aprox. €65, comida de 3 platos por la noche era alrededor de €20 y yo aparcamos fuera en la calle.

titulo: Bien ... los huéspedes no son tratados como clientes.
conteudo:
Me he alojado en España en un Holiday Inn Elche (cerca de Alicante aeropuerto). Me quedé muy sorprendido y me disgustó que por el día de los enamorados no podía con mi familia disfrutar de la cena en el restaurante del hotel. Dado que reservamos las habitaciones hace pocos meses, el hotel debería tener al menos tener en cuenta que los huéspedes que se alojen en el hotel debería haber sido considerado como tal, y nos dieron la oportunidad de cenar en el restaurante. Sólo es cuestión de logística que uno sepa el número de reservas.

Hemos ofrecido a cenar en nuestras habitaciones. ( ¿ ?) me pareció estar en un hotel en un hospital. Elegí el Holiday Inn porque se supone que es un hotel de 4 estrellas y debido a su ubicación próxima al aeropuerto. Apropriada mis tipos habituales de hoteles (Sofitel, Fairmont como), esto es sencillamente inaceptable en cualquier hotel pretender ser un 4 estrellas.

Además nos pidieron no ir al bar de la azotea de este desacuerdo, ya que también era reservado para este evento. Triste.

Al final nos salimos a cenar (un lugar en coche, ya que el hotel está situado en una zona industrial con nada).

El hotel debería haber sido más precisos sobre la logística y su mayor parte organizaciones que, en general, a los huéspedes de la cuenta que han reservado hace mucho tiempo y dormir en el hotel. Nadie nos dijo ni por SMS ni por correo electrónico que reservar el restaurante porque de este día especial con antelación. Hice mi reserva hace unos meses a través de hotels.com. El menos hubiera sido entonces para informar a los huéspedes Corn llenos (aunque vinieron a través de Hotels.com u otras fuentes de reserva) ya que el hotel puede ponerse en contacto con esas fuentes de reserva que entonces aparecerá informará a los clientes. En otras palabras los huéspedes que se alojan en el hotel, incluso cuando eventos especiales están teniendo lugar debería ser contabilizado (o al menos dar la posibilidad de cenar incluso en otra sala de comedor).

Esto no es exactamente como su anuncio diciendo El Holiday Inn puede hacer promesa para mantener a la gente volver. No ir a Alicante un par de veces al año, pero no siempre que necesite un hotel. Supongo que la próxima vez que necesite una, que se piensa dos veces antes de volver a reservar el mismo hotel, aunque tengo que admitir que el hotel es bonito y limpio. Una pena para el servicio por el cual el recepcionista se disculpó (no fue culpa suya después pero en mi opinión una fuga en la gestión y de la logística.

R. S.

El hotel está situado en un parque industrial a 10 minutos en coche desde el aeropuerto de Alicante. El check in fue fácil y rápido, que es muy agradable llegar tarde por la noche. Habitación grande con una cama cómoda y wifi gratis. El baño es de buen tamaño con una ducha que yo prefiero un bathttub. El desayuno nos dio una gran variedad en el buffet. En general, la calidad de precio estaba bien, sólo he pagado unos € 65,- por alojamiento y desayuno. No volvería a alojarme aquí si era para el turismo, que prefiere un hotel de la ciudad, pero para negocios, dudo hay una mejor oferta de encontrar por aquí.

titulo: Habitación limpia, diseño moderno, original servicio de restaurante.
conteudo:
El Holiday Inn está situado en un parque de negocios (alias zona industrial) entre Alicante y Elche, fácilmente accesible desde la autopista o más pintoresco y de la vieja ruta costera entre las dos ciudades - más pintoresca, agradable paseo en coche por la tarde.

Nos alojamos aquí para pasar un fin de semana y explorar Elche a principios de diciembre. Hay un amplio parking gratuito en frente de la zona de restaurante, curiosamente algo desaprovechado y quizás una 'resaca' desde el auge de la propiedad hace una década. El amable recepcionista convino en nosotros una moto en vista de la recepción, un gesto. La recepción inicial fue muy amable y eficiente, con una cálida bienvenida de la señorita que era un verdadero mérito al hotel. Eso fue una de las mejores experiencias de nuestra corta estancia.

La habitación en sí era muy aceptable, con puertas dobles para proteger del ruido del vestíbulo - era útil, como un equipo de fútbol juvenil ruidoso corrimos los pasillos de los pisos inferiores por un par de horas el sábado por la noche. La cama era una habitación doble, como habíamos pedido, con distribución de la habitación bien pensado y atractivamente diseñadas para un hotel barato. Las habitaciones que dan a las del sur puede ser muy caliente en el verano a través del cristal si las cortinas se dejan abiertos.

Atracciones en Elche estaban a nuestro asombro todo cerrado para el 'puente' (fin de semana de vacaciones). La atracción principal local en el parque de negocios parecía ser un gran número de tiendas de zapatos, popular con carloads de personas locales. Cerca de la estación de servicio se venden botellas de agua, aunque la tía sirve esa noche era bastante pretencioso.

Había un gin tonic libre [y] como parte de la promoción y un vodka u otra bebida etc. ofrecieron si es necesario. La medida era normal, servido en un vaso grande con un montón de hielo y sienten molestadas de limón, la única decoración. El barman español más tarde doble como un camarero, y aunque mi compañero es y habla sólo español, consideró oportuno deliberadamente cambio idiomas (práctica) sin preguntar - cómo grosero. Cuando nos dijo que hablan español respondió que había trabajado en Inglaterra por unos pocos meses (así? ! ). Aparentemente no muy aceptar su error o dispuestos a comer humilde pastel y daños su orgullo, debidamente asignados un camarero diferente a nuestra mesa, aunque el nuevo y más joven (un sábado empleado para estudiantes) era mucho mejor para nosotros. El desayuno de buffet de una buena noche de sueño antes del desayuno la mañana siguiente fue bueno, aunque el tocino demasiado grasos, más el blanco de color rosado.

Probablemente debido a oficina central o política de gestión, parece que hay una política en este hotel y quizás la cadena de diciendo todo dos veces, es decir traduciendo todo. En algunos casos tiene prioridad sobre inglés español - inusual y probablemente no mucho para el gusto de la mayoría de los clientes españoles que cuando nos alojamos en la mayoría. También había una o dos divertidas graffitis comentarios, uno de los cuales está sobre un bidet faltante en el baño (ver foto).

En general - una gran recepción, bastante peculiar camarero y barman, práctico para zona de Elche, no está mal para una noche o dos como máximo.

Fantastic Hotel. Lovely staff. Food was excellent. Arrived at 10.45pm and still got served a full 3 course dinner menu €12.
Taxi €15 from airport or €1.50 on the bus outside the hotel.
Room was really modern with a great shower.
Staff very helpful
Really close to Alicante airport.
We will definitely be back!

This hotel is in a quiet location but less than 15 minutes drive to the airport.

Comfortable well maintained rooms, great service from the staff. Good Spanish restaurant.

The hotel is quiet at the weekends although the restaurant gets busy between 14:00 and 16:30 on Sundays,when the Spanish eat their main meal.

titulo: Ideal place to stay when travelling in/out of Alicante
conteudo: I recently spent a restful night here before flying out of Alicante Airport. My room was spacious and comfortable, with a great shower. The reception staff were especially helpful and friendly. It was a short drive to the airport so very convenient. Thankyou.

Had a business lunch there that was not good at all. The entrée was a boring salad and the other one, an overcooked green pasta that was barely eatable. The deco lacks personality. Quite a disappointment

Due to the storms we were abandoned at the Elche bus station.
After waiting over 2 hours I contacted the receptionist at the hotel (hoping to book)
Not knowing our situation she could not have been any more helpful. I was given a taxi number (as none were attending the station) and when we booked she was very helpful seeings as her own life had also been affected by the storms.
The hotel was full due to the situation.
The staff, bar, restaurant and reception were very attentive. They worked their socks off.
The rooms were comfortable and a well needed rest was had.
The menu of the day was great value for money and very tasty.
To all members of staff Thank you
It maybe out of town but it is an oasis worth a visit.

Stayed before flying home dinner was buffet style good for the price charged room very clean plenty of towels and good shower would recommend it for staying before traveling or when you arrive in Alicante free parking on site which is a bonus.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 days with my new husband of 5 months, we just wanted a nice little break away after our honeymoon, I will never return to this hotel, let me start by saying I am a receptionist for an airline company and the receptionist in this airport hotel was very unhelpful, very bad, secondly there was no toiletries in our room no soap to wash your hands, there was no tea/coffee making facilities in our room, very bad, the prices at the bar constantly changing , what's that about, food is awful we were half board same food for the 4 days, we found a dead fly in the food, only positive thing was the pool , the biggest disappointment is the hotel is in the middle of nowhere , industrial estate not good, no shops restaurants vending machines nearby, bus service is also very bad, every 2 hours, but doesn't show up, as I work for an airline company I most definitely Will Not Be Recommending this hotel!!

Perfect location close to the airport at Alicante. Spotlessly clean, friendly staff and nice comfortable rooms. Wr had a lovely lunch in the bar area, all the food was fresh and to a very high standard. The pool area is spotless and very refreshing, a proper little sun trap. Will definitely use again in future for airport stop over.

Enjoyed stay. Fantastic menu. Very clean.Underground parking.Lovely room.Friendly staff. Highly recommend.Swimming pool. Lots of places to relax as chairs everywhere. Breakfast was included in our stay.

Beautifully clean very friendly and helpful staff. The pool area was very private. The hotel is set in the middle of an industrial estate and with no car it felt like the middle of nowhere. We stayed overnight before going on to our holiday destination and although the hotel was very comfortable I would not want to be there to long

titulo: Great stay but will not be returning
conteudo: We had a great stay here lovely large room,bed comfortable,bathroom modern and big walk in shower. Bar and restaurant staff were attentive and friendly thought we had found a great hotel to overnight at before our flight!When we checked out we asked the receptionist for a direct telephone number so we could book in the future. Anyway phoned last week to book three separate dates and the receptionist was so rude we will not be staying here again and have booked elsewhere.

Lovely hotel. Swimming pool too. Breakfast included. Great room. Though couldn't open window. Friendly staff. Bit far from a beach. Bonus security of underground parking. Very clean. Cheap menu. Lots of space to sit about.

titulo: Great for a business trip, wouldn't go there on a holiday though.
conteudo: Stayed here on a business trip, just one night. I chose it for the location, which was super convenient for the airport. The room was spotless and very comfortable. Despite being so close to the airport (I actually saw the hotel from my plane window as we landed), it was perfectly quiet. I had dinner and breakfast in the hotel. Dinner was okay for the price. Breakfast was better. There was supposed to be a free airport shuttle bus but it never showed up and I ended up getting a local bus (1.20 euros) which still got me to the airport with plenty of time to spare.

titulo: Not an opinion of the hotel - of the bar/restaurant
conteudo:
The bar/cafe area is always 'lightly' staffed. I waited a mere 15 minutes for service this lunchtime - and in the end had enjoyed the adventure of finding someone myself - like in a department store.
I order a grilled cheese and ham sandwich. The presentation was ... minimalist. The cheese was delightfully un-melted. The bread was semi-over-toasted for that carbon-not-carbon combination. The bread had been dipped in lashings of butter (possibly margarine). The chips were a paleo diet style, I think.
And all for just €4.50. Only double the price of a café just around the corner for the pleasure of sitting in a designer hotel lobby wondering if I will get served before I have to go back to work.

I wanted to visit my friend, who stayed in this hotel, in the lobby. There wasn’t any signs on the doors that dogs are not allowed there. I went in with my dog and then one lady came and said in Spanish that dogs are not allowed. Next time it’s more nice if the hotel worker apologize first and then ask what language the visitor speaks...

And the top was that I was one day (before that situation) also there with my dog and I took coffee in the bar and nobody said to me that dogs are not allowed. Very rude...

You should put the signs that dogs are not allowed in your hotel then visitors know how to make plans with their (furry) friends.

This was our third visit. It is about five miles from the airport and very easy to find, so good for catching an early morning flight or if you have arrived late at night. It's modern, comfortable and well suited for a one or two night stay. The restaurant serves a reasonable variety of dishes at very good prices. Parking is easy, mostly on the street immediately outside the hotel or there is an underground car park (12euros a night). The hotel is located in quite an interesting area of 'outlet' stores, if that's your thing and it's on the bus route to Elche.

Fabulous modern hotel. We only stayed one night before using Alicante airport (7 mins away) but cannot think if one bad thing about it. Free toiletries, comfortable beds, great flat screen tv, great breakfast. Wished we were staying longer.

Stayed overnight with a tour group travelling around Spain and Portugal. It's a modern hotel and has a courtyard in the middle. Room and bathroom were nice and clean, and bed was comfortable. Breakfast buffet had limited choices. Located in an isolated place and it would be difficult to stay in this hotel if you don't have your own transportation.

Great location, pool, rooms, nice beds, easy parking, but really horrible food. The dinner was almost uneatable!! Would have been top score if they changed the food/chef. Will book another hotel next week

We arrived herr after our flight was cancelled.. have to say the hotel is lovely and has a lovely pool but I don't understand what it's doing there .. a 4 start hotel in the middle of a industrial estate and the US nothing around.. our stay was nice we enjoyed the pool but the 2 day they started to drill out the tiles outside and our room was right on top so that was it for the relaxing time as between planes and drilling when u were outside u couldn't hear yourself

titulo: Turned away on arrival in spite of having a valid booking
conteudo: Left a good review after my last stay but this experience has left a bitter taste in the mouth. Arrived at 22:00 and told that they had a special event on and my booking was moved to a different hotel. I'm on a business trip and the new hotel is an hour out of my way in the morning and will cost extra in taxis. No opportunity was given to cancel the booking and find a more convenient hotel. My advice is to avoid this hotel at all costs.

Was booked into this hotel after Ryanair cancelled our flight.
Arrived tired and hot.
Enrique welcomed us and told us all the usual information in a kind, welcoming manner.

Definitely a stop off type of place as it was in the middle of a (clean) industrial park.

Hotel was spotless.
Evening meal was very basic with the bonus of a large glass of red wine.

All channels in Spanish (not complaining just an observation as we are in Spain)

Bed was SO comfortable - slept for 10 hours

Breakfast was fabulous.
We knew we had a 12 hour journey ahead of us so we ate like little piglets
Vast choice:
All types of
coffee, tea, hot choc, juices, milk, water
Fruit
Pastries
Cereal
Jams
Bread/toast
Hot breakfast

The pool was adequate, looked clean, with good quality sunbeds and artificial grass.

There is a payable mini bar and various vending machines in the hotel.

Thank you for putting us up after Ryanair cancelled our flight.

What can I say. Arrived over an hour later than scheduled due to flight delay. No problems checking in family of 11, even after arriving after midnight.
Good breakfast, staff really friendly and helpful would certainly stay again. Excellent value for money thank you.

I stayed overnight at Hotel Port Elche 2 weeks ago together with my daughters (ages 11 and 13), my elderly parents and my nephew (age 12). We booked the hotel as we arrived at Alicante Airport late in the evening and wanted somewhere decent to stay near the airport before travelling to our holiday destination. We were not disappointed. The hotel is modern and well appointed, the rooms spacious and clean, and the breakfast (only €6!) was excellent. I think that the reviews on here that are non-complimentary about the hotel location (on an upmarket retail/industrial park about 5/10 minutes taxi ride from Alicante Airport) are missing the point that this is essentially an airport hotel, not a hoiday destination. It is great value for the quality of the hotel, and we could find no fault with it at all. My only small gripe is that the airport taxis are fairly expensive (€15-17 one way to the hotel from the airport), but this is not the hotel's responsibility. I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Port Elche in future.

Stayed here on 29th July due to our flight being cancelled by Ryan Air. Ryan Air sorted the booking so we had no choice in the matter.

Enrique on reception was helpful. Told us where the public bus would pick us up in morning to take us to Alicante airport which is roughly a 10 min journey and takes you right outside airport departures.

Hotel reminds me of a holiday inn and had 4 stars on sign outside. Rooms slightly dated. Beds comfy and had tv in room but no English channels. Toiletries in bathroom and hair dryer.

As we were there due to a cancelled Ryan Air flight the menu was a set menu and not very appetising albeit edible but starter wasn’t our choice.

You either ate the meal or went hungry. No choice for kids either. Although staff did in the end after parents shouted brought out chicken nuggets. I guess the hotel was working on a budget set by Ryan Air for per person so had their hands tied. If you were a paying guest the menu was better. You could tell staff weren’t impressed with the Ryan Air customers but the customers weren’t impressed by the menu choice . A bit of animosity shall we say

Lovely little pool outside but hotel in the middle of an industrial estate so good for being closer to airport but no shops or places to eat close by. You’re stranded.

Stayed here on Sunday 29th due to Ryanair cancelling our flight! Well what can I say, the rooms were ok but definately not four star, no tea or coffee making facilities. We were given an evening meal if you can call it that! Scrambled egg with mushrooms and prawns mixed all together , then cold pork and chips followed by 3 profiteroles for pudding. The menu said pork and potatoes, and when asked about this the waiter just shrugged his shoulders, when asked for a drink they said no! Just water! Though it was clearly on menu we could have 1 small wine, 1 beer or 1 soft drink each! Clearly Ryanair are paying for goods that this hotel is certainly not delivering to their customers! Oh and we also had the sour faced waitress who banged and crashed our plates on the table and wasn’t interested in serving any of us!! Charming staff!!! Not! Wouldn’t stay here again if it was the only place to stay! Rubbish!!!

Just spent 2 nights at this hotel. A break from driving to Marbella. Had a brilliant time. I can not find fault with anything. The location, staff, rooms, food and pool all outstanding. Would recommend and stay again.

Stayed here on Monday 25/6/18 till Thursday 28/6/18 due to easy jet cancelling our flight on Sunday 1 hour before take off ? classy company.Anyway they booked us in here hotel is very clean beds are comfortable staff mostly friendly but a couple need a good talking too the wee guy at reception who could not wait to tell us we were bed and breakfast when in fact we were full board so on Monday we had no breakfast no lunch and no dinner cheers ya clown.The restaurant is in my opinion very poor breakfast is rotten if you like everything cold it’s for you cold scrambled eggs cold bacon if that’s what it was sausage that is in fact a big hot dog chopped up couldn’t even have a glass of orange juice as on that morning no glasses ,the 12 Euro lunch and dinner menu yes it’s the exact same both sittings is shocking my wife ended up with a plate of chips twice yum my grandson didn’t even go in once as well he knew it was all garbage very poor for an alleged 4 star establishment now there is a member of staff in the restaurant soria or something like that well she’s the entertainment banging plates down glaring at customers a four faced girl who want to work somewhere else like a prison the management need to have a word with this rude and horrible individual. Would I stay again NO don’t even have a vending machine for nightime if your thirsty no pool table one hard bench out front to sit on pathetic.One group of employees who deserves praise are the cleaners who keep your room absolutely spotless well done them .A big thanks to easy jet for ruining my holiday anyway cheers

Nice modern clean spacious bedroom and building. Friendly staff were happy to speak English. Great value for money overall and located close to the airport, perfect for dropping back our rental car early! Swimming pool under construction. Location is a bit off beaten track but not bad once you have a car, if it was in the city it would cost 3x the price I’d imagine !

titulo: Great hotel- bring back the old restaurant
conteudo:
I've been staying here for 6 years. Obviously as a Holiday inn until last year

Rooms are fine- pillows need replaced- bar and bar staff great- great receptionist- although there is a Manager who needs to understand customer service.

The Restauant - ONIX- was brilliant in the past, but last week's set price dinner was among the worst meals I have EVER eaten!! Explain that.

The price was silly- €12- but given its previous track record we reckoned it would be eatable. We didn't expect premium- but eatable yes.

Service was dreadful- pre plated dried up food flung in front of you- it was like a workers cafe not an hotel restaurant - never mind a 4 Star Hotel restaurant.

Starters were Ok- but only OK- however the main course fish , potatoes and peas were disgusting. If I had received it at a LITTLE CHEF!!!! It would have been returned- however I was a guest at dinner so wouldn't complain.

Cold, dried up, unappetizing - dreadful

Desert was little better - synthetic defrosted rubbish

What a shame

I will stay in the hotel again but unless there is a massive change I will NEVER eat in ONIX

Great staff and spacious rooms, very comfy and clean, also great breakfast, only thing i missed the bus to airport because the night receptionist gave me the wrong timetable for bus time, breakfast should be a bit earlier i think as some people have really early flights, day receptionist was very kind and helpful

We stayed at the hotel Elche and I have to say we were impressed. The hotel is very modern with nice rooms and bathrooms. The restaurant was doing as special offer which was excellent value and very nice food. The price of a beer was 2-2.5 euros which is great. Staff a very friendly and it’s very clean.

This isn't a Holiday Inn, although they didn't tell me when I booked my room on the IHG (Holiday Inn) website. I notice that it's also listed as a Holiday Inn on Agoda and Trip Advisor. The big sign out front still says Holiday Inn, as do some things inside. When I tried to check in, though, the woman at the front desk told me she had no booking for me. At issue here beyond the fact that I showed up at midnight with a reservation confirmed by email from IHG is the collection of points from IHG for future free nights.
The woman at the front desk finally found my booking and I got my room. IHG, however, tried to tell me I didn't qualify for points for the stay. After considerable wrangling, they finally gave me points and a qualifying night, but I didn't appreciate having to email, beg, and argue about these benefits.
The hotel seems to have been removed from the IHG website, which is laudable, I guess, although it was more than a month after the company and property were no longer affiliated.
Incompetence? Duplicity? I don't know, and don't really care.
The hotel itself? It's located in an industrial park and isn't great but isn't bad, except for the fact that it's a 15-euro taxi ride from the airport. The whole experience left me annoyed.

Our flight was cancelled last minute so we managed to book a room here. 5 min journey from the airport in a taxi which was pricey at €15. Hotel was clean and we enjoyed our 3 course meal for only €12. Receptionist very helpful with printing our boarding passes, booking us a taxi and giving us toothpaste as ours had ran out. Definitely recommend if you have an early flight and want to be close to the airport

titulo: Clean hotel but in middle of nowhere with nothing near except a garage
conteudo: Stayed here whilst working away as the hotel we usually stay in was full. You get what you expect from a holiday inn, was clean and tidy, food was OK but not great it has to be said. This hotel is in the middle of an Industrial estate with absolutely nothing near it except a garage. Its ok if you are working at one of the businesses nearby but would not opt to stay hee again. A week was enough.

titulo: BE AWARE - No longer a Holiday Inn from 11/01/2018!
conteudo:
We have used this hotel a few times over the years after arriving late into Alicante. It's great for an overnight before driving onward the following day.

I booked a couple of rooms for next August as our flight arrives at 23:30. I used my IHG reward points for a reward night and booked another room that I would pay for. This evening I received an email to say as of 11th January 2018 this hotel will no longer be a Holiday Inn and my bookings are cancelled. I now have to find alternative accommodation which, as you can imagine during school holidays is incredibly expensive! The only other Holiday Inn in the vicinity - playa de san juan does not now have any reward nights but did at the time of booking Elche some months ago.

What annoys me more is that you can still book both on the app and the Holiday Inn website and there is no mention of the change of ownership or that your booking will be cancelled.

The same thing happened to the Alicante Holiday Inn Express on the seafront that we used in the past - it became a B&B hotel. Come on IHG, what is going on in Alicante?

This place is a good stop as it not to close to the city centre and not to far from the air port if you need it
there is an nice restaurant in the hotel and the breakfast was quite nice as well
We where driving so we could go in and out of the city as we pleased and driving in the city itself was easy

titulo: Clean hotel but middle of nowhere
conteudo:
I stayed here for one night prior to a flight from airport. It really is in the middle of nowhere and the 10 min journey to airport is expensive at 15 euro since both coming and returning a 4.85 addition was added to fare, goodness knows what for.

The guy on reception was not very welcoming and seemed to spend most of his shift chatting to the person on the bar.

Rooms are large and clean and also quiet.

Restaurant has odd opening hours and only opens at 8pm for dinner, which is not great.

Check out was efficient and the receptionist spoke good English.

Overall, a good hotel in the middle of nowhere and I probably would not return.

Stayed here for few nights prior to leaving Alicante so to be near airport and also to explore this area around Elche.
Lets start with the positives. If you have a car and are on business then this hotel will be ideal. The breakfast is plentiful, fresh and with a good choice. The rooms are cleaned well and you will get a lovely nights sleep. The room rates are reasonable.
Things slightly different if your a tourist. Yes the airport is 10 minutes away by taxi approx 15 euro but thats were it ends. The staff at this hotel are not very accommodating, not very welcoming, their English is awful considering they are on reception. The IHG loyalty programme is pointless, its all very well displaying promotional material about the scheme but you need to feel valued and appreciated when you are a member but sadly here you won't be valued as a IHG Member. I have Platinum Status but I could easily have had no status its a fruitless task even mentioning it to them.
They have bikes outside but all were broken when I asked to use them. They only serve Pizza and Basic Sandwiches in Bar area before 8.pm that's it.
The Resturant does not open till 8.pm. Their is a bus that should stop outside hotel every hour but its sporadic so don't rely on it
The hotel is in the middle of a Business Park and its isolated and depressing. Their is no where to walk nothing to see....if you dont have a car its awful as no shops, no eateries, no atmosphere nothing..... The train station is miles away in Elche so need a taxi to get to it aporox 20 euro. If you want to go to Elche itself on taxi its approx 28 euro each way. The place is dire it really is and its not even worth staying for one night its so bad without your own transport. If on the otherhand you dont mind paying out 60 odd euro return in taxi to Elche or waiting hours on end for the mystery bus to airport then suit yourself
I can categorically state I will never return to this hotel again. Shame really just needs to have other stuff in area as this is the only hotel and its like a ghost town come after dark.

titulo: Nice hotel in a strange location
conteudo: Choose the hotel for the proximity to the airport in Alicante. For that purpose it was perfect. Easy to access by car, 24 hour reception, nice rooms, good price. If you are not coming late or leaving early to or from the airport I don't really see why you would stay here. That is if you are a tourist. There is nothing going on in the area. If you are in the area to explain the region by car, the price is probably attractive, but don't expect anything extraordinary in the evening. One restaurant at the hotel other than that nothing.

titulo: Nice hotel in a middle of nowhere
conteudo: Great hotel for one night stay on the road. Stayed here few times and I can recommend easily. Good value. Car needed. Not a beach destination. Close to airport, but not shuttle. Parking in garage only 4 Euros per night. Easy access to Elche and Alicante. About 5 km from the Alicante Airport.

The hotel is very convenient if you arrive at late night to Alicante's Airport. The rooms are clean and the buffet breakfast is nice. The decor is modern and consistent with the standards of most Holiday Inns, nothing spectacular but correct and practical. It would work great for people who needs to visit Elche's factories as it's in the middle of an industrial estate. Friendly staff

I booked two rooms for ten days during a recent holiday to Elche. The hotel was easy to find and is located in an industrial park outside Elche. There is ample free street parking around the hotel. I would say a car is essential if staying here. Roughly ten miles to the nearest beach. We are Spire Ambassadors in the IHG reward scheme and had booked both rooms on reward points. The check in was smooth with no language issues , we only speak English but we were not offered the usual drinks or points voucher we got on our last stay. However the rooms were adjacent as requested and the hotel was clean and comfortable. There was ain't bar in the room but no tea making facilities which is common in Spain, though the bar did a good cup of coffee for €1.80. We didn't try the food this time as we prefer eating out. The hotel bar was well stocked and again the servers were efficient, friendly and good at their job. We did use the sauna but this was only switched on by request. The hotel is quite industrial in appearance on the inside which I like and would happily go back to this area and stay here again.

titulo: Depends what you are looking for
conteudo: Me and my friend where only staying here as we needed something nearby to airport for our flight the following day. Hotel is of great standard! A lot nicer than usual holiday inn's. Lovely, clean and modern. Reception staff were very friendly. It is in the middle of nowhere with nothing round about so wouldn't recommend if you are looking to go out here. Menu for food was rare. Beds and pillows where the comfiest ever!!

titulo: Not our usual holiday inn experience
conteudo:
My fiancé and I travel around often and stay in various hotels, staying in a number of UK Holiday Inn hotels, and unfortunately this one wasn't our usual holiday inn experience.
We booked to stay at the Holiday Inn, Elche, as we had a morning flight back home from Alicante airport. The staff on reception we couldnt fault, they were very helpful and very knowledgable, but the rest of our stay was a different story.
Unfortunately, we couldn't eat at the restaurant for dinner because I was allergic to a majority of the dishes, which of course wasn't the hotels fault- but I'm just explaining my experience. Perhaps a variety of different foods in the hotels restaurant would be helpful to customers? So we decided to go to the bar, as there was food I could eat there. The hotel was not busy in the slightest, with only 2 other people sitting around the sofas in the bar area. My partner and I waited at the bar just over 20 minutes before we saw somebody round the side of the bar and asked if they could serve us. We could have understood if the hotel was busy, but at the time we were there, which was about half an hour before the kitchen closed, it was almost empty. After purchasing from the bar, we went up to our room, where we had 2 single beds that had been pushed together, the most uncomfortable strange-shaped pillows, and a interconnecting door leading the room next door to us, which people were staying in who we did not know. Of course the door was locked, but we felt uncomfortable when the door was tried a few times. We could barely sleep all night. After our experience we couldn't wait to just get home.
Apart from the staff at reception, the only other thing we were pleased about was how close the hotel was from the airport, making the transfer to the airport very accessible and easy.
Unfortunately, we will most likely not stay at the Holiday Inn, Elche, again. Which is a shame as it was very local to the airport.

We spent 6 nights visiting beaches and places around. The hotel has been a wonderful choice: the price very convenient considering we were in high season, all services excellent, the hotel very new, modern and stylish, with a nice gym and sauna area, the room super comfortable, clean and spacious, the breakfast buffet wide, fresh and tasty. The hotel is based in a logistic area, so away from crowd and confusion of towns around especially in summer season: ideal then for people travelling by car like we were, with plenty of free parking around in the night, just close to alicante airport and to the highway connection to beaches and all directions. Btw if you are a runner, there are plenty of pedestrian routes for KMs around to train.

titulo: Don't waste your money having breakfast
conteudo:
I booked this hotel as I had to be at the airport early. I should of asked first as to what time breakfast started midweek ( I would expect airport hotel to start before 7am) .

I paid the rate for bed and breakfast but was unable to get a hot drink or a cold drink before we left.
Hotels at the airport should not charge for breakfast if you are on a early flight. They could offer a breakfast on the go bag that you can pick up on your way out
The room was nice enough bathroom okay . The other disappointment was that as a international company they only offer TV in Spanish or German NOT one English channel. As I spend as least 10 visits to Holiday Inn UK I felt very let down.
The last and important issue was that when we arrived the reseptionist totally ignored us and then picked up the phone and kept us waiting for a good 53 in.

We booked a room at the Holiday Inn fairly last minute as we had a flight the next morning from Alicante Airport. We found it easy to get parked. We did book a double room, however, we were put into a disabled access room. If I am completely honest, we didn't get any sleep, the pillows were a very unusual shape and were very uncomfortable. Another few things I need to mention, it took just over 20 minutes to get served a coffee at the bar when there were no other guests around. Also, the restaurant on site has a very limited menu and doesn't cater to every guests taste. Apart from that, staying here made it very easy to get to the airport the next morning. I wouldn't make any special effort to return here based on our experience. Although, staff were friendly enough.

We booked this hotel because it was close to the airport. We dropped the car off the night before since we had an early flight. The hotel ordered a cab for us when we checked in and it was there right on time. Very modern hotel, rooms are nice, restuarant opens at 8 o'clock and have a 'menu' special (3 course meal), very reasonable and very good. Nothing much else around this property but works well for a hotel stopover.

Stayed here 3July, 2 rooms at 95 euros each. Rooms clean, reasonably comfortable but no tea and coffee facilities, never been to a Holiday Inn without this facility before and having to leave at approx 7am without my morning cuppa was disappointing.

Staff were all very pleasant.

Had a meal in the restaurant, the T bone steak was huge but tough and a strange mix on the plate with whole green peppers, courgettes and sliced potatoes that did really taste of anything.

The rack of lamb was lovely.

The hotel was nice but the missing tea and coffee made it disappointingly.

Clean and comfortable hotel with cheap decent food at the restaurant.
Not expensive at all for what it offers. Nice interior decoration. At the heart of Elche very modern Industrial park.
Too bad the fitness room has un properly maintained equipments.

titulo: Modern hotel situated on industrial estate near airport
conteudo:
Close to Alicante airport this Holiday inn is clean and modern, situated in an industrial complex there isn't much close by with regards to restaurants or entertainment.
We tried the hotels own on site restaurant which was poor, we ordered the grilled Goat cheese and mushroom salad - the goats cheese on small slices of touched bread was ok but the mushrooms were warm and slimy, the lettuce had a balsamic reduction splashed over it.
The paella, when brought to the table in the pan 8 euros each - minimum 2 people, looked okay but it was quickly whisked away and plopped on 2 cold plates then brought back to the table. It was actually horrible, there was no lemon provided to squeeze over it to balance the overly fishy flavor.
We hardly touched both, then paid and left. Still hungry we went up to the room and ordered room service, it arrived 20 minutes later, mixed sandwich with fries and side salad, the chips were cold, the salad warm and the sandwich sweating with its bread toasted only on 1 side, soggy on the other. The club sandwich was worse, the uncooked streaky fatty bacon that had slithered its way onto the top of the omelette and meager chicken was enough to put anyone off, the same rank chips and salad adorned the side.
The whole tray was left outside the room with a sack the chef message.
The hotel is not bad for a short layover 10 minutes from the airport but take your own food.

We just stayed one night to break up our onward journey. Nice, clean room. Modern hotel, ideal for a short stay. It cost us €15 to go from and to Alicante airport.

The hotel restaurant stays open to 11pm, had we realised this we would have eaten there. The breakfast was just the normal continental style, plenty there to help yourself to.

titulo: Good base for airport and to explore Elche Palms
conteudo: Very quiet and easy to check in. The rooms were OK, although, as mentioned previously, the air conditioning was not the strongest. Very friendly and helpful staff. We ate in the restaurant. The menu del dia was very good value at €12. The other dishes were OK. We thought the rice dish was a little salty and our steak came medium rare and not well done, as requested. That said, the quality and quantity of the breakfast was much better. Drive to petrol station for hire car is minutes away and en route to airport.

Location can not be called very attractive, but hotel itself is pretty new, clean and tidy. Still the best asset they do have is their staff. Our flight was cancelled very early hours in the morning with no knowledge of the replacing flight.I made a desperate call to hotel as I knew the place. They arranged us a room wiht late check out and also a taxi ride, as the airport was already pretty deserted that time. Excellent service I must say.

Stayed one night as a stop over from the airport.
Taxi cost just over €17 and takes about 10 minutes.
Rooms clean and tidy. Air con wasn't cold/strong enough for me so I found the room to be warm. Can't hear the planes or traffic.
We opted for the continental breakfast and be warned, they are very strict! You are only allowed ONE coffee, ONE piece of toast and ONE glass of squash! I think this should be made clear on the flyer in the bedroom, because we wouldn't have bothered if we had known this.
Lady on reception very helpful and spoke good English.

titulo: Great overnight stop for Alicante Airport
conteudo: Located on a business park didn't sound very attractive but as it is only a couple of miles from the airport we booked for the night prior to our return trip to the UK. The hotel was easy to find and has its own parking. Very modern looking but very attractive interior and good sized bedroom with ensuite walk-in shower. A very comfortable night and reasonably priced if you shop around the websites.

Stayed 3 nights at this hotel one in January 2017 and two in March. Really convenient location for Alicante Airport and close to a petrol station for fuelling a hire car on a full to fill rental basis before returning it to the airport. Friendly staff. Only downside was that the rooms were very hot and the air conditioning appeared to have been turned off. We slept with the window open which resulted in a lot of noise especially in the morning as the hotel is located on an Industrial/Business park.

Stayed for one night as had early flight back to U.K. Next day. Would highly recommend. Close to airport fro, its industrial location with good parking (free) on road outside. Don't let its location put you off, inside it is modern, clean, light with and aired relaxed feel. Rooms are good. We had small bit from reasonably priced mini bar in room, few drinks in bar, 3 course meal with drinks in restaurant and for less than €45. The staff even set us up cafe con leche and croissants at 5am before we left. Great value, would definitely use again.

Modern on the outside of an industrial park, really handy for Alicante Airport. But the soundproofing is crap and glad we were there out if season. Couldn't control the air conditioning in the room and the hotel itself was overly warm, resulting in an uncomfortable night. Food was average. Furnished and cleanliness to standard you'd expect from HI.

I had to visit Alicante on Family business so was looking for a business hotel , found this one online and it was very good friendly , clean and I could also get a good three course meal at a reasonable price late into the evening , with lots of free parking outside the hotel on the road ,

We were put here overnight when there was a problem with our flight home. The hotel coped really well with a sudden influx of a plane-full of tired passengers, providing us all with a meal and comfy bed.

Dinner was basic, there was a choice for vegetarians on request. There weren't quite enough seats for us all in one go, but we all got fed which was no mean feat given the number of people. There was a good choice for breakfast.

Our room was nice - accessible, clean and comfortable. No kettle or water provided. Staff were friendly and particularly the restaurant staff worked incredibly well.

Accessibility:
The hotel was easy to get into, and our room was great. The bathroom was fully accessible although a little slippery underfoot for someone who is a bit wobbly. The shower seat could be positioned on different rails - an excellent design. The toilet had a rail on one side.

Modern airy hotel with comfortable rooms facing an internal atrium - could be noisy on occasion I guess but not on our Saturday night when it was almost empty. No doubt because the main market is visitors to the surrounding commercial estate - very big so satnav is a must to find it. Very friendly staff. Two breakfast options - continental (coffee, juice and roll/pastry) for 4 euros or buffet for 7+ euros when included in the rate. In addition to reasonable quality cereal, eggs, bacon, fruit, cheese and ham, breads and pastries etc there was a fantastic grilled vegetable mix (aubergine, courgette, pepper etc). Might be the best breakfast have had in a Spanish chain hotel. Only the coffee, which was OK but not over hot or tasty, could be improved.

Stayed here in Nov as a last min booking, we fancied a bit of comfort after staying in cheap Benidorm hotel! The holiday inn was extremely clean and the staff were all friendly. Beds comfy and rooms spacious. The food in the restaurant was delicious. My only niggle was that they had a 24hr menu in the rooms but when we tried to order some food from it at 6pm ish we got told the kitchen was closed. Disappointed only because it stated 24hour menu. By the time the kitchen opened the food was worth the wait!
Nice and close to the airport and the staff kindly booked a taxi for us. Cost €15 one way and €17 the other so not the cheapest considering it's so close!

Good holiday Inn standard. Clean and room are OK.
The breakfast is according to the standard.
Parking is available.
Staff are polite and helpful.
The location is at the center of the business center .
the building has a big large lounge.

Located in characterless industrial park on the edge of Elche, this pleasant hotel offers an ideal base for people arriving into Alicante airport late, or those setting off early in the morning. Spacious rooms and airy public areas. Pleasant staff, decent free wifi and free parking in the roads around the hotel.

We stayed here on a short break to spain.

The hotel was very clean and the staff helpful.
Breakfast was basic ,but for what there was ,it was nice.
the dinner menu was limited bit agian the food it self was very nice.

The mini bar was very reasonably price.

titulo: A business hotel that does not help the business traveller
conteudo: The hotel ius cozy and clean but the room is beginning to show usage. Not many choice for food and it is the only choice you have if you do not have a car, even if you have a car, still need to ride like 15 minutes for a restaurant. Now, what a businessman needs is internet and rest. The internet speed is 1.44 Mbps, according to the speedtest.net but it is when the signal is on because it is very unstable. The noise level is high so not good rest neither. Second time here and the same problems. The only good thing is all customers are within walking distance.

This is a modern hotel with a minimalist decor. The rooms are situated on a landing overlooking the lobby. The room was reasonably comfortable but the pillows were very thin. We arrived late and went for a drink in the bar but the barman kept disappearing and as I came down a few minutes after my friends, I never saw him, so didn't get a drink.

As a newish member of the IHG, I was hoping to get some points from my one night stay. I presented my card at the reception and he said my points would be added. However when I got home this had not happened. I was told to contact the hotel as I had made my booking through a 3rd party website. I emailed the hotel and apparently in this case the points are added at the discretion of the hotel. I wasn't aware of the IHG app at the time of booking. I think this was rather mean, especially as it was only one night. It is a pity that the receptionist gave me false hope.

titulo: Nice hotel shame about the Restaurant
conteudo: convenient hotel for an overnight stop. on and industrial estate. but the restaurant is not good - poor service, poor quality food. reading previous reviews the manager says that things are being improved - well, they haven't yet. But I suppose as there is no where near by to eat, they have the monopoly, so it doesn't matter to them what service they provide. it would be a good idea though to change your chef and to train up your waiters. One good point is your man on reception Enrique, he does the work of 10 of your other staff. you should treasure him.

I was arriving late into Alicante, and needed somewhere close to the airport, and reasonably priced. I was a little nervous about the location (on a retail/industrial park), but the hotel is great...very friendly staff, good rooms, and everything clean and tidy. It's about 10 - 15 mins in a taxi from the airport, and approx 15 Euros for the taxi. I wouldn't normally stay in a chain hotel, but this was a pleasant surprise - especially the excellent staff.

Decent hotel stacked over a few levels, but, a business hotel and not for holiday makers... In the middle of an industrial estate but very clean and well presented with kind and friendly staff... Food was very disappointing, however.

titulo: All that is missing is a swimming pool!
conteudo:
Stayed for three nights (visiting friends in the area) at the start of our Holiday and then for one night 10 days later, having been further afield, before we flew home.

The Hotel itself is located in a semi Retail / Industrial Park in between the A70, CV-86 and the N-340. It is easy to find and only 10 mins drive back to the airport.

Regardless of the less than favourable reviews I have to say it was a great find and will be using the Hotel again. Efficient and very friendly check-in. The rooms were excellent, great size and a large shower room (first stay) and bath tub with over shower (second stay). Excellent Wi-Fi, Aircon and reasonably priced mini bar. Iron & ironing board is available on request. Limited TV but the TV’s are modern and you can attach media to them. The hotel does charge for secure parking but there is plenty on street parking around the Hotel. There is some aircraft noise from landings at the airport but overall it is a quiet area – exceptionally quiet in August as the industrial area seems to be on holiday.

There's not a lot to do around the hotel, no bars or restaurants but for dinner you should give the onsite ONIX Restaurant a go. Plain and simple food with good service and exceptional value at 11 Euro per person for three courses. Choice of several dishes at each course to boot!

If you want to explore the surrounding area there are places to eat in L’Altet along from the Airport road (CV-849) and the beach between Urbanova and Arenals del Sol is great too. Santa Pola with Pink Flamingos in the salt flats and La Marina with its beach are about half an hour away as is downtown Alicante.

Having your own transport due to the location of the hotel is a must. Taxi to Elche or Alicante is 15 / 20 Euro.

I made one tiny suggestion to the Hotel – install a swimming pool because that’s all I felt was missing.

Will definitely return to the area and definitely book here again.

Hotel was good, clean, good value and the staff were really helpful also allowed us to use the gym to shower later in the afternoon after we'd checked out.

It is in the middle of an industrial estate, no noise issues but it's about 20 mins to Alicante central, 20 mins to the nearest beach and about 15 mins to Elche town centre.

Definitely does not live up to usual IHG or Holiday Inn standards! Having travelled most of the night we were met by a miserable and rude receptionist. We were given a key card with a number scribbled on it and the receptionist failed to give any directions as to how to find the room and failed to give any information about the breakfast, the wifi, check-out or facilities. The room we were in didn't have a room number on the door either...the only way to find it was to look at the rooms either side for the numbers. Really really disappointing!! On check-out, again, lack of customer care and unenthusiastic staff that didn't even bother to ask how our stay was.

Stayed here unexpectly when Easyjet cancelled our flight. It about 10 mins from airport on an industrial estate.
The receptionist did an excellent job of allocating rooms very quickly , note one of our rooms said no smoking but clearly someone had been smoking in it previously!!

Rooms clean and modern , air con worked ok .

Breakfast was a bit frantic but I suppose they weren't expecting 200 people to arrive on Sunday night!!!

Room was good but that is as far as good goes. The hotel is situated in the middle off a large industrial estate with no shops or restaurants in the area. The restaurant in the hotel opens at 8pm no other snacks or food is offered before then. When the restaurant eventually opened the food was terrible and very very small portions (never have i had a 3 course meal then had to go order room service). Staff were really friendly and helpful when you could find them but that is not their fault they were extremely understaffed. I have stayed in many Holiday Inn hotels including the one in Baghdad and this one is by far the worst.

titulo: A good location for a short drive to Alicante airport, modern hotel, terrible after service.
conteudo:
It is a nice hotel, well situated for a short drive to Alicante airport. it has modern facilities with paid underground car parking, however there are lots of spaces on the road adjoining the hotel for free. The prices for the food etc are very reasonable.

That is the positive bit out of the way, however I have encountered some very disappointing service from this establishment because they provided no responses whatsoever following the mishandling of my payment for my stay. In addition whilst there, there was a local sports event attracting teenage clientele to the hotel. Like most teenagers on an awayday, they were very noisy during the evening running up and down outside the room, the management having to intervene on a couple of occasions.

I used one of my free nights to book a stay, and on arrival the receptionist told me that I was required to pay for my visit. After explaining and proving it was a free night, she eventually confirmed this explaining that she had never seen this type of booking. A couple of weeks after arriving home, I saw the hotel had arbitrarily arbitrarily deducted €111 from my credit card, I contacted customer services at IHG and they intervened saying the hotel would respond to me. After several days not having received a response I then contacted customer services again and they eventually refunded my money still without any contact from the Hotel. To then add insult to injury, the Hotel deducted a further 10,000 points for a stay that I never had. Without boring you any more, I got the points refunded by customer services and I still have not heard from the hotel. Overall, extremely poor and unacceptable after service from the hotel and thank goodness IHG customer services intervened and sorted the matter out. It appears the administration in the hotel is a shambles and nobody takes ownership of any problems.

titulo: Excellent short stop over airport hotel
conteudo:
If only our UK Holiday Inns were of this same high standard !

We stayed here for just a one night stop over either end of our 10 day holiday ( as we had very unsociable flight times). Not far from the airport, just 15 Euro fare. The hotel is of a very tasteful modern design with a very clean and comfortable bedroom and en suite bathroom. There was a mini bar but sadly no tea/coffee making facilities in the room.
Breakfast partly buffet and partly waitress served was very good with an excellent choice. Dinner was very good indeed, one of our favourite meals of that holiday ( being a chef in part of my working life, I tend to be somewhat critical when it comes to eating out). We could not fault a thing and even intend to make a stop over again next time, so we can enjoy another lovely meal. I never thought I would say that about a Holiday Inn!

titulo: Close to airport and is what it says it is
conteudo:
Last minute booking due to late flight arrival, short EUR 15 taxi ride from airport. Friendly helpful staff at midnight for my check in, nice clean room, the ordered taxi arrived on time next morning for easy trip back to airport to pick up hire car and drove to final destination in Javea.
Business park hotel but not it is not an industrial area.

Holiday Inn happened to be in the right place for us. We thought it as a tired business hotel smack dab in the center of an industrial area with limited surrounding amenities. Next time through, we will lokk for something in town with a bit more character.

We stayed here for a night at either end of our holiday. It is very well placed for the airport, is easy to find and about 10 minutes away. It's in an (albeit very neat and orderly) industrial area so hardly a place for a longer stay. No fuss check in, lovely room and good restaurant - on a Friday night we had an excellent three course meal plus a glass of wine for 10 euros each! Plenty of comfortable space on the ground floor to sit and chill. Will stay here again.

titulo: Great overnight stay, perfect for the airport
conteudo:
Had a one night stop here before dropping friends at the airport for their flight home - it's in a very odd location, but easy to find and only 10 minutes drive back to the airport. Have to say it was a great find. Very friendly check-in and a very nice modern style hotel. The rooms were excellent, great size and a large shower room (nice large walk-in shower and good water pressure). The hotel charges 4 euros for secure parking (under the hotel) but there is plenty of on street parking around overnight. There's a little noise from aircraft landing at the airport, but other than that, it's a quiet location on the weekends (we stayed on a Friday night).

There's not a lot to do around the hotel - but for dinner you should try the onsite ONIX Restaurant. Plain and simple decor, but excellent waitresses, great service and the food was just as good, with a three course menu of the day with a drink (beer, soft drink, water or wine) and bread for just 10 euros per person. Highly recommended.

Would definitely book here again.

This is a nice Holiday Inn in what is a pleasant Spanish town. The area the hotel is in is quite industrial and there's not a great deal around it but we were there on business so it suited us fine. The staff are very helpful, the restaurant more than adequate, just beware though, whilst we were there a German lady had her bag snatched. There is an entrance into the restaurant directly from outside and a chap blatantly walked in and stole the lady's bag whilst she had gone to use the toilets. Rooms are a decent size and very clean.

Stayed here for 1 night as had morning flight from Alicante, airport is 10 minutes away and easy to get to. The restaurant was very good and we had a 3 course meal for 12 euros. The hotel has parking below for free. We are booked in again in Feb and will use the hotel whenever we have a morning flight. Recommended.

titulo: Open House for Spanish carpet industry
conteudo:
Comfortable 4 star business hotel near to Alicante. People in the hotel are very friendly and will do the utmost to meet your requirements.
Rooms are spacious and clean.
Only disadvantage of this hotel is location far from city centers of Alicante or Elche. However hotel is only 10 minutes from the airport and taxis are cheap and efficient..

We had an early flight from Alicante airport so chose to stay here for a second time. This hotel is only a 10 minute drive from the airport with excellent road links so no hold ups.. It is clean comfortable excellent staff. It is also great value for money for an overnight stay so close to an airport. Would stay again if in location with early or late flights. For a bed and meal you cannot beat it. Nothing around the hotel if you are looking for entertainment stay elsewhere.

It's a taxi ride away from anything, including the airport and Elche/Alicante. It's IMPOSSIBLE to find a bus stop in the industrial park surroundings. Don't even try, sent on a wild goose chase by receptionist in 30 degree heat. The AC was not strong and the beds weren't super comfy. The bar staff were very friendly though, and the bathroom was massive.

titulo: Great hotel close to Alicante Airport
conteudo: We stayed one night after a late flight. Hotel is close to Alicante Airport. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable. The restaurant had a good standard. The food and service was excellent. The hotel is located in the middle of an industrial area with many outlet stores. We didn't realize it at the time, but everything shuts down from 2pm to 4 pm for siesta time!

titulo: Does what it says on the tin
conteudo: It's just a place to stay !! It modern, clean, generally very cheap, convenient for late flight arrival, or early morning departures. It's very close to Alicante city and all that goes with it. Breakfast is, well, basic. Could easily be improved with a tweak in the food, that would uplift the experience for little extra cost.

titulo: Great value overnight stop close to Alicante airport
conteudo:
Stayed for one night after a late flight. Hotel is located in the middle of an industrial estate, but don't let that put you off.

Family was upgraded from family room to two adjacent rooms, one twin, one double. All for 90 Euros (without breakfast). Rooms were clean and nicely appointed. We were even able to get some food late at night (about 11pm). Bar food and beer were of reasonable quality and well priced. Even the mini-bar was quite cheap. Staff were very helpful and polite and spoke English when my Spanish failed.

Breakfast was OK - 8 Euros for a full breakfast, although the scrambled egg and bacon were not so good.

We parked in the underground garage overnight - cost about 4 Euros.

Stayed at the holiday inn for an overnight stay before I had to get a flight home. I checked in and went to my room, I was pleasantly surprised when walking into my room as it was very modern and spacious and came with a mini bar. I sat at the bar in the afternoon and later at night, the food was very good and prices were fair, the only criticism I would have would be that more staff may be needed at night as waited 20/30 minutes to get served at the bar for food. The hotel is situated in an industrial estate an the closest beach is 15 euros in a taxi, didn't really bother me as I had read the reviews and knew it wasn't close to anything. Got a great price an a grea night sleep, would definitely be back again!

titulo: Good clean, well priced stopover hotel
conteudo: This was booked as a quick stop off hotel due to having a very early flight the following morning. The hotel is in the centre of an industrial park so there is no point in getting there early as there is nothing to do. There is lots of parking, the rooms are clean and modern and really quiet. The evening meal at only ten euros per head was delicious, this was for three courses and a drink. I would definitely stay here again if I had an early flight

Hotel is located 8 minutes from Alicante Airport, 18 euros in a taxi so great for an overnight stop.
Without boring you and myself with the details, I missed my 10pm flight so found myself stuck at the Airport with only 2 euros and my credit card and no phone charger!!
After being recommended Holiday Inn Elche mainly for its close locality to the Airport and reasonably price, I arrived at midnight down trodden and weary.

The lovely Mar at reception, greeted me with a warm sympathetic smile, found me an iPhone charger that I could keep until the morning and arranged for coffee from the bar.
The next morning she sorted my taxi etc for my second attempt at getting on a flight and really nothing was too much trouble for her.
The rooms are spacious and modern and really can't fault for roughly £50 a night.

Thank you Mar for making my short stay very pleasant under the circumstances!!

As a platinum IHG member I was a little disappointed with the customer service at this hotel.

The hotel is on an industrial park and looks very nice from the outside.

I think I arrived at the hotel about 11.30 pm and the receptionist checked me in whilst having a conversation with another Spanish lady and her glass of wine.

I was not greeted as a platinum member and was not offered any benefits normally associated with this.

The room was adequate though the shower tray in my room had 2 large cracks across it, not sure this was really a 4 star hotel.

Breakfast was adequate, not sure about the scrambled egg which seemed to be a coagulation of egg with burnt bits in it.

Check out was a much more pleasant experience, and no that wasn't because I was leaving...the receptionist was much more professional.

The hotel rate was reasonable but was irritated with the check in.

We stayed here as a stopover before flying out of Alicante. Yes, the hotel is in the middle of an Industrial Estate (as it's address states), but is very modern, very clean and very efficient. If you want to go out in the evening, however you may want to chose somewhere else. For us, this was perfect. It was quiet, with a nice bar/ reception area which had good, free WiFi. The staff we encountered were all very pleasant and efficient. We did not eat an evening meal but we did have excellent Gin and Tonic's and wine in a comfortable seat in the bar area. The bedroom was clean, bathroom very modern with a great shower, and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was nicely presented and was buffet style. We booked a taxi to the airport the following morning which arrived within 5 minutes and the fare to the airport was 17 Euros (their business could benefit from a shuttle service). Good experience - will do it again.

Very friendly,first class service and the staff spoke good english.The food in the restaurant was excellent ,so good in fact we ate in every night that we were there ,and it was very reasonable only 12 euros for a 3 course dinner including a drink
The room was so fresh and clean,everything changed every day,staff were so helpful and looked after us as if we were family.
As the hotel is on an a very modern industrial estate with many outlet shops and on the outskirts of town it is better to hire a car.

the hotel is located right next to the famous industrial area of elche. it looked very modern not like some old worn out holiday in that is around since grandma was a teenager. they serve very good gin and tonic and there is a very good bar atmosphere

Stayed there one night after our arrival to Spain. Choose this hotel because it was close to the airport. It is located in the middle of an industrial area - in the evening it is completely deserted and quiet.

Room was clean, but very small. Double bed turned out to be just two beds pushed together - not good for couples used to cuddling together when sleeping. Bathroom clean, with good water pressure in the shower.

Free WiFi works properly in the lobby, while coverage extends into the rooms it doesn't work there. Seems others had the same problem as you could see people with laptops occupying the lobby in the evening.

Ate late dinner at the hotel restaurant. We wanted to order a rice dish, but waitress warned us it may be too heavy in the evening and recommended the day's menu set. It consisted of a salad, a simple but tasty dish of grilled chicken with rice and creamy sauce and a flan as dessert - all of that was pretty good.

Breakfast selection limited, but good quality with two exceptions: scrambled eggs clearly made out of a factory-made mix, inedible - and coffee that was positively repulsive. Actually, that coffee - or to be precise lack of palatable coffee in the morning - was what did cost this hotel one point in my review.

We got put up in this hotel after our flights got cancelled.
The hotel is in the middle of an industrial estate with nothing near by in walking distance.
The hotel was very clean and set to a good standard.
The hotel staff spoke very little English.
The room was cleaned and restocked daily.
The food was ok nothing to rave about.
The bar prices was through the roof.

Good clean stopover hotel after flying to and before flying from Alicante Airport. Not easy to find but very good once located. Good restaurant and easy parking make this hotel a winner. Definitely recommended

Good hotel for one night when you are travelling. Situated on a businesspark near the airport of Alicante. Non smoking room, despite a light smoking smell. Good service. Breakfast okay. Staff very kind and service-minded. Parking: No problem.

I booked this hotel for 1 night before going to Benidorm for the rest of our holiday. I booked it because it was an airport hotel and said it had an airport shuttle bus online -it doesn't! We had to get a taxi,5 mins away but a €20 fare...each way. It is in the middle of an industrial estate, so no bus stops nearby. And nothing else either.We had dinner after arriving, it was terrible. And breakfast was no better. Very little staff, and not great English speakers.
What I thought I was saving by staying here, I ended up spending on taxis and food. Should have just booked a Benidorm transfer for the night of arrival and stayed in my lovely hotel there.
Will not be back and I do not recommend!

Again while working in the area with no fixed place to stay, I look for hotels on Tripadvisor / google, to find familiar chains where I know I can just show up and everything will work. Doesn't always work out, but this one surely did. Predominantly I wanted somewhere near-ish to the airport as that would be my next stop and when I arrived I was blown away by the large peaceful atrium style. Room was spotless, everything worked, service was good in the bar and restaurant even coped well with about 100 children who were staying there on some kind of sports tour! Will certainly stay here again when transiting through ALC. Room was approx. €65, 3 course meal in the evening was about €20 and I just parked outside on the street.

titulo: Well...guests are not treated as Guests
conteudo:
I have been staying in Spain in a Holiday Inn at Elche (near Alicante Airport). I was very surprised and upset that because of Valentine's day I couldn't with my family have dinner in the restaurant of the hotel. Given that we booked the rooms few months ago, the Hotel should at least have taken into account that guests staying at the hotel should have been considered as such, and given the opportunity to also have dinner in the restaurant. It is only a matter of logistics as one knows the number of reservations made.

We have been offered to have diner in our rooms. (???) I thought to be in a Hotel not in an Hospital. I chose the Holiday Inn because it is supposed to be a 4 star Hotel and because of the near location of the Airport. Disregarding my usual types of hotels (Sofitels, Fairmont like), this is just unacceptable for ANY hotel pretending to be a 4 star one.

Furthermore we were asked not to go to the bar on the top of this disagreement as it was also reserved for this event. Sad.

In the end we went out for dinner (somewhere by car as the Hotel is situated in an industrial area with NOTHING around).

The Hotel should have been more accurate on logistics and its consequent organisations taking, in general, into account guests who have reserved long time ago and sleeping in the hotel..
